title: Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Professional Galaxy letar efter någon som kan vara att ingå i ett team som implementerar ett nytt system för att övervaka, administrera och uppdatera hanteringen av extern mjukvara samt hur vi hanterar de IT-säkerhets krav som åligger vår utvecklingsmiljö som används inom organisationen. Denna utvecklingen sker i ett agilt team och det är inom detta området vi nu behöver växa med en erfaren mjukvaruutvecklare med bakgrund inom IT-säkerhet och har ett antal års erfarenhet och som är intresserad av att vara drivande i att utveckla ett nytt system och uppfyllande av IT-säkerhetskrav.




**Vidare i rollen så kommer du:**

* Utveckla mjukvara enligt kundens gällande riktlinjer och praxis.
* Bidra i att lösa HUR en funktion ska se ut och implementeras.
* Arbeta med nyutveckling, förbättringar och buggrättning.
* Utföra kodgranskning och skriva enhetstester.
* Använda verktyg för att visualisera data
* Dela med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenhet, i och utanför teamet.
* Bidra till ett välfungerande team med en positiv attityd.




**Din profil**


 För att lyckas i rollen är du en person med några års erfarenhet av utveckling, gärna Golang, Python, Java och Camunda. Vi ser gärna att du arbetat med microservicar och liknande lösningar. Vi ser det också som en fördel om du har kunskap inom mockning och något testramverk. Men framförallt så är du en social person som gillar att jobba tillsammans med andra, agera mentor åt mer juniora personer och har god förmåga att kommunicera i både tal och skrift svenska såväl som engelska.





Vi ser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att leda ett team med mjukvaruutvecklare





Du är en person som:


* Har några års erfarenhet av rollen som utvecklare med bakgrund inom CyberSecurity
* Gärna har jobbat med att ta fram mjukvaruarkitektur för ett nytt system
* Brinner för att utveckla säker och välfungerande mjukvara
* Har kunskap om git, Jenkins och/eller liknande CI setup
* Är högskole-/civilingenjör eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Har god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift både på svenska och engelska.




Vi letar efter en ny medarbetare som gärna har ett antal års arbetslivserfarenhet.





Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Kunden har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


**Submission deadline:** 2025-11-14 (11 d left)

**Duration**: ASAP - Open

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**About the job**

  


We’re a fast-moving technology company delivering exceptional services across product development, UX design, and content administration. Our mission is to help clients build better digital experiences through thoughtful collaboration, consistent communication, and high-quality execution.



We are looking for an ambitious **Frontend Developer** to join our growing team. We expect our Developers to have strong technical skills, curiosity, and the ability to take initiative.



If you are passionate about implementing and learning new things in the front-end field, this role is for you!

 **As a Senior Frontend Developer at IGS you will:**


* Architect, design, and develop features and components
* Build modular layouts, reusable code, and libraries
* Help set technical standards and best practices for the front-end team
* Monitor and improve frontend performance, ensuring fast load times and smooth interactions.
* Experiment with new tools and frameworks to continuously improve the development process and product quality
* Mentor junior developers and conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and adherence to best practices.
* Participate in agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives.

  


**You will be successful in this role when you have:**


* At least 3+ years of experience developing front-end web applications
* Expert understanding of client-side scripting and JS frameworks such as Angular
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs and integrating frontend applications with backend services.
* Good knowledge of SEO principles and web analytics, and ensuring that the application will adhere to them
* Excellent communication skills and experience in collaborative environments
* Strong analytical, organisational, and time management skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Fluent written and spoken English

 **Why join IGS?**

  

At IGS you are not recruited to work *for* us — you are hired to work *with* us. We are fully invested in your professional growth and development, and we want your work to be engaging, fulfilling, and fun.

  


We have a vibrant, multicultural office with colleagues from over ten nationalities, and we are proud of our inclusive, collaborative culture where everyone helps out and supports one another.

  


We offer competitive compensation and industry-leading benefits, including generous vacation and parental leave, comprehensive insurance and pension through Swedbank, and plenty of opportunities to connect — from team-building activities and company events to weekly breakfasts and fika.

  


Our office is located in Solna, just a short walk from both Tvärbana and Pendeltåg.

 **We’d love to get to know you!**

  


Please apply with your CV, and feel free to include a short cover letter if you’d like to tell us more about yourself and why you’d enjoy working with us.

title: Systemutvecklare till Videnca
description:
*Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär, där du får arbeta i hjärtat av IT-driften, omgiven av riktigt vassa kollegor och med en avgörande roll för samhällskritiska lösningar? På Videnca får du kombinera tekniskt djup med ansvar, utveckling och innovation, varje dag!*

På Videnca kommer du jobba tillsammans med övriga kollegor mot ett gemensamt mål: att bygga trygga, hållbara och framtidssäkra IT-plattformar.


Som Systemutvecklare kommer du bli en del av Infra teamet, där du tillhör den högsta tekniska nivån på Videnca. I ditt arbete kommer du se till att våra interna och externa tjänster vilar på en stabil, säker och optimerad grund. Du kommer bland annat:


* Leda förändringsprojekt för det aktuella system
* Delta i design, utveckling och förvaltning av våra system
* Arbeta aktivet med att säkerhetsställa att alla plattformar levereras inom ramen för Videncas certifieringar

#### **Vem vi tror du är**


Vi tror att du är en teknisk doer med ansvarskänsla, nyfikenhet och passion för IT-infrastruktur. Du gillar att lösa problem och strävar alltid efter det lilla extra i dina lösningar.


#### **Vi tror att du har goda kunskaper i:**

* C#, ASP.NET samt MVC-ramverk generellt
* SQL och databashantering
* REST-baserade API:er

#### **Vi ser det också som mediterande om du har erfarenhet av:**

* React
* TypeScript
* Python och Django


Hos oss får du möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad och bli en del av ett samhällsviktigt bolag där många kunder har samhällskritiska funktioner och höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet. Vi uppmuntrar och stöttar en högpresterande kultur, strävar alltid efter att lära av varandra och bidrar till en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt engagemang. Vi investerar löpande i verksamheten och i våra medarbetares kompetens.

#### **Praktisk information**

* Anställningen är säkerhetsklassad vilket innebär säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen. Du behöver därför vara svensk medborgare.
* Urvalet och intervjuer sker löpande, vänta därför inte med din ansökan!

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
* Ansök senast: 23 november 2025
* Kista
* Hybrid
**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

Tele2 is looking for a full-stack developer to complete our team, Digital Sales, in the B2C IT Engineering department.


Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.


Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.


**This is the job**

At B2C IT Engineering you will be a key-player in building and perfecting our sales- and service systems. Our goal as a pioneer is to build the smartest and fastest sales system in telco. To achieve this we work with the fastest technology, experiment a lot and put a lot of effort into understanding our users and their needs. We are continuously delivering and improving on sprint basis.


As a person you understand the big picture and are willing to learn new things - and you are always ready to walk the extra mile to ensure a high-quality product. The daily job will include contact with several different teams and departments, and we believe you have excellent collaboration and communication skills. As a person, you are open, driven and are not afraid to take own initiatives.


**This is what you have**

* Strong background as a full-stack developer with 3–5 years of experience
* Core skills: TypeScript, React, Astro and Node.js


* Experience and/or strong interest in cross-platform design, design systems, and shared components
* Proven track record in projects involving complex business logic
* Fluent in both Swedish and English
* Possibility to work at our head office in Kista, Stockholm, three times a week

**Who are you?**  



* A team player who enjoys contributing from start to finish alongside the team
* Comfortable working in a mature agile environment and thrives in it
* Curious, open-minded, and driven to continuously develop and improve
* Enjoys supporting and mentoring others in the team with their growth
* Motivated to explore new technologies and stay at the forefront of innovation
* Values close collaboration and actively participates in mob and/or pair programming daily
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

* Tjänstepension
* Flexibelt arbetssätt med möjlighet till hybridarbete
* Möjlighet till interna karriärvägar och utveckling
* Föräldralön
* Rabatter på Tele2s produkter och tjänster
* Inkluderande arbetskultur
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

**What Tele2 can give you**

Working at Tele2 you will work in a creative and flexible work environment. You will be a part of culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward. Every employee is important for the company’s success and you will always have an impact of your work. We provide you with the opportunity to grow and develop through internal paths within the organization.


At Tele2 we aim to build an inclusive company in a diverse world. Does this sound like a suitable position for you? If so - we look forward to receiving your application!  

  



**Interest and application**

Please note that in compliance with personal data management regulations (GDPR), we are unable to accept CVs via email.


Warmly welcome to submit your application! To ensure an inclusive and fair recruitment process, we focus on your experiences and skills. Therefore, Tele2 has chosen not to consider cover letters. Instead, we kindly ask you to answer the screening questions included in the application form.


*To ensure a fair and unbiased recruitment process, all candidates are invited to complete a coding test as part of their application. These assessments, provided by Alva Labs, are designed to give everyone an equal opportunity to showcase their strengths beyond just a CV or interview.*

*Additionally, Tele2 performs a background check on final candidates.*

**Några av våra medarbetare**
-----------------------------

Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"På Tele2 siktar vi högt för att skapa obegränsade möjligheter"*
Fanny
Systemspecialist Unified Communications
*"Arbetsmiljön på Tele2 främjar både personlig och professionell utveckling, och det finns betydande möjligheter för vidare karriärutveckling"*
**Om företaget**
----------------

På Tele2 arbetar vi målmedvetet varje dag för att fortsätta vara ledande inom hållbarhet, vilket har lett till att vi blivit utnämnda klimatledare i Europa av Financial Times. Tele2 är också Sveriges mest hållbara företag och rankades 37:a globalt av Time Magazine och Statista på deras första lista över världens mest hållbara företag med 500 företag från över 30 länder. Vi fortsätter att uppnå nya mål och vi hjälper våra kunder att uppnå sina hållbarhetsmål eftersom vi åtagit oss att övergå till en cirkulär ekonomi.

  


Our Values; Be Brave, Take Action, Make it Simple and Act Cost-efficient.

  

  

Enable "functional cookies" to watch the video
company_description: We enable the transformation of businesses and the creation of tomorrow’s infrastructure. Connecting people and technology far and wide, as well as right here around us. Simple. Sustainable. Smart.

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
#### **Make an impact with us**


We are seeking a skilled **ServiceNow Developer** to join our growing team in Sweden. In this role, you will be a key contributor to ServiceNow implementation projects, continuous agile development cycles, or DevOps-based delivery engagements. You will collaborate closely with Solution Architects, Technical Architects, and customer stakeholders to turn requirements into high-quality, scalable ServiceNow solutions.


This is a hands-on development role where you will configure, customize, build, and challenge technical requirements to ensure optimal platform outcomes. Our ideal candidate combines deep ServiceNow technical expertise with a proactive, quality-driven mindset.

### **Key Responsibilities**

**Platform Development & Configuration**


Develop, extend, and configure ServiceNow platform components, including:

* Workflows, business rules, UI components

* Portals, Workspaces, Notifications, Virtual Agent

* Code/low-code/no-code app development

* Security and intelligence features

* Implement Service Catalog items, automated workflows, and approval logic


**Custom Development & Scripting**

* Write, test, and debug server-side and client-side JavaScript

* Create and maintain Business Rules, Script Includes, Client Scripts, UI Policies, etc.


**Integrations**

* Design and develop integrations using APIs, web services, middleware, and secure data exchange patterns

* Configure data mappings and ensure proper security controls


**Data & CMDB Management**

* Build or extend data models, tables, schema, and relationships

* Manage CMDB and other platform data structures

* Handle data import/export and transform logic


**Quality & Delivery**

* Work in agile delivery frameworks

* Conduct unit, integration, and performance testing

* Participate in deployment activities

* Challenge and refine suboptimal requirements or designs in collaboration with architects and customers

* Produce technical documentation for handover and support


### **What we are looking for**

* Hands-on experience as a ServiceNow Developer in implementation or DevOps environments

* Strong knowledge of ServiceNow modules, platform components, and best practices

* Proficiency in JavaScript and ServiceNow scripting frameworks

* Experience with integration technologies (REST/SOAP APIs, web services, authentication protocols)

* Understanding of Workflow/Flow Designer, UI Builder/Portals, and CMDB concepts

* Familiarity with agile development methodologies

* Strong communication and analytical skills

* Ability to challenge requirements to drive better solutions


**Bonus Skills**

* ServiceNow certifications (e.g., CSA, CAD, CIS modules)

* Experience with ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, HRSD, or other ServiceNow products

* Low-code/no-code platform experience


### **Why Join The Cloud People?**

* Work with a certified Elite ServiceNow Partner

* Opportunity to grow your career with leading-edge ServiceNow initiatives

* Collaborative, knowledge-sharing culture with top-tier experts

* Flexible work arrangements and supportive team environment

title: Backend developer
description:
We are looking for senior backend engineers to join us and expand our team of talented backend developers. You share a passion for building systems that delivers high business value without sacrificing maintainability, availability, scalability and quality. You will work on the backend systems that power our casino platform and help us deliver the best customer experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and help operate our systems
* Drive technical improvements throughout the stack
* Together with product teams deliver the best games and business solutions
* Help scale our solution to customer requirements and business opportunities


 Who you are
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience working in a mixed Java, SQL, Javascript environment
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning
* You are curious, driven and not afraid to take charge and improve the system and add automation where needed
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in
* You have experience from working on large Java systems and have a solid understanding of performance, scalability and availability challenges of distributed systems
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* You know your way around a modern Unix/Linux system
* Experience with modern deployment, monitoring and logging solutions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Junior C++ Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a talented C++ DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Sweden. In this role, you will bridge the gap between software development and operations, leveraging your expertise in C++ programming and DevOps practices to streamline our development processes and enhance our product delivery pipeline.
   

  

* Develop, maintain, and optimize C++ codebases for high-performance applications
* Design and implement robust CI/CD pipelines to automate build, test, and deployment processes
* Collaborate with development teams to improve code quality, system reliability, and scalability
* Manage and optimize containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes
* Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues in production environments
* Develop and maintain documentation for DevOps processes and best practices
* Continuously evaluate and integrate new technologies to improve development and operations workflows
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to team members
* Contribute to the company's overall DevOps strategy and culture
* Work three days at the customer location or in the office


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* 1+ years of experience in C++ development, with a strong understanding of modern C++ standards
* 1+ years of hands-on experience with DevOps practices and tools
* Proficiency in version control systems, particularly Git
* Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI
* Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems and shell scripting
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and their DevOps-related services
* Experience with containerization technologies, especially Docker and Kubernetes
* Knowledge of infrastructure as code principles and tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible)
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or Bash
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, ELK stack)
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities
* Understanding of agile methodologies and software development lifecycle
* Relevant DevOps certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Docker Certified Associate) are a plus


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Backend Developer Intern   [Remote]
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Backend Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in
 **API development, system integration, and backend architecture** 
 .
 



 This is a
 **remote, hands-on role** 
 where you will work closely with experienced developers to design, implement, and maintain backend services that support our AR platforms.
 



 While this is initially
 **unpaid** 
 , exceptional performance may lead to a
 **paid position** 
 after the internship.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Develop APIs** 
 : Build and maintain high-performance REST APIs using
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js** 
 .
* **Database Management** 
 : Work with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 and ORM tools (Sequelize) to design and optimize database schemas.
* **System Integrations** 
 : Assist in integrating backend services with AR platforms and machine learning pipelines.
* **Testing & Quality Assurance** 
 : Write and run
 **unit and integration tests** 
 to ensure stability and performance.
* **DevOps Support** 
 : Learn to work with
 **AWS cloud infrastructure** 
 and contribute to maintaining scalable, secure environments.
* **Troubleshooting & Maintenance** 
 : Help debug, patch, and optimize backend systems to improve reliability.
* **Code Reviews** 
 : Participate in peer reviews to maintain code quality and follow industry best practices.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in
 **Node.js** 
 and
 **Express.js**
* Solid
 **JavaScript** 
 &
 **TypeScript** 
 skills
* Experience with
 **PostgreSQL** 
 (basic to intermediate)
* Familiarity with
 **AWS services** 
 (some training provided)
* Understanding of
 **Git** 
 (we use Bitbucket)
* Basic knowledge of
 **CI/CD pipelines**
* Awareness of
 **IT security fundamentals**
* (Bonus) Experience with
 **Sequelize ORM**



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience building backend systems for
 **real-world AR applications**
* Exposure to
 **AWS-based scalable architectures**
* Experience with
 **industrial-grade API design, testing, and security**
* Involvement in a
 **live product launch**



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Our client is expanding and looking for a skilled
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 to join their team. You’ll play a key role in developing a new implementation service that connects external data systems to their core platform, an important part of enhancing product performance and customer experience.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full stack using
 **React, TypeScript, Python and AWS** 
 , creating
 **serverless REST APIs, intuitive UIs, and robust ETL pipelines** 
 that enable smooth and efficient data flows between systems. The role offers end-to-end ownership and close collaboration with a small, driven team where your input truly matters.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop new features for the implementation service across backend and frontend
* Design and maintain serverless REST APIs
* Build UI/UX flows in React and TypeScript
* Work with ETL tools such as AWS Glue and DataBrew
* Collaborate with internal teams to improve data integration and automation



  





**Requirements:** 



* 3–5 years of experience in fullstack web development
* Strong knowledge of
 **JavaScript, TypeScript, and Python**
* Experience with
 **ETL processes and data integration**
* Understanding of
 **REST APIs and cloud services** 
 (preferably AWS)
* Passion for
 **clean, structured, and scalable code**
* Analytical and solution-oriented mindset



  





**Bonus:** 
 Experience with React, Vite, PySpark, SaaS platforms, or ETL/data pipelines.
 



  





 This is a great opportunity to join a fast-growing tech company, work with modern tools, and make a real impact from day one.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Role: Qliksense Consultant** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Type: Contract (B2B)** 




  





**Job Description:** 




 Design, develop, and implement engaging, high-performing Qlik Sense applications, dashboards, and visualizations that address business intelligence needs in Sweden.
 



 Execute end-to-end data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) from diverse sources to build, optimize, and maintain scalable Qlik data models.
 



 Partner with business stakeholders to gather requirements, translate complex analytical needs into actionable Qlik Sense solutions, and deliver meaningful, data-driven insights.
 



 Optimize application performance and ensure compliance with Qlik best practices for data governance, security, and quality assurance.
 



 Provide ongoing maintenance and user support, resolve data and application issues, and produce comprehensive technical documentation for deployed solutions.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Java
description:
**What you will do** 




 • As a backend Java developer, you will work within a specific problem space critical to Klarna’s current needs where you will design, develop, and deploy backend services with a focus on scalability, high availability, and low latency.
 



 • Collaborate and grow in a dynamic and autonomous environment while working in small, agile, and cross-functional teams.
 



 • Use the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale.
 



 • Be part of a team that takes full operational responsibility for the services you own, and potentially take part in an on-call rotation.
 



 • Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.
   





**Who you are** 




 • Extensive software development experience with one or more general-purpose programming languages, including but not limited to Java.
 



 • Great problem-solving abilities.
 



 • Working proficiency in English.
   





**Awesome to have** 




 • Experience with Java (latest versions).
 



 • Familiarity with Spring and Spring Boot.
 



 • Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes.
 



 • Experience with Kafka.
 



 • Database experience in PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, and Elasticsearch.
 



 • Familiarity with microservices architecture on AWS.
   





 Please include a CV in English.
 



 Curious to learn more about Klarna and what it’s like to work here? Explore our career site!

title: Backend .NET Developer – Sundsvall
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 A technology-focused organisation in Sundsvall is seeking a
 **Senior .NET Developer** 
 to join their growing engineering team. This role offers the chance to work on modernising core systems, introducing event-driven architecture, and driving technical initiatives alongside an experienced Tech Lead, Principal Architect, and skilled development team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Lead and contribute to the design and implementation of scalable backend services and APIs.
* Shape system architecture with a strong focus on performance, maintainability, and security.
* Develop event-driven components using technologies such as Kafka or Azure Service Bus.
* Drive improvements across CI/CD pipelines for smooth and reliable deployments.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (frontend, data, product) to deliver impactful solutions.
* Mentor junior developers and foster a high-quality engineering culture.


**Requirements:**
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in C# / .NET (Core or later).
* Solid understanding of event-driven architectures (CQRS, event sourcing, messaging systems).
* Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, etc.).
* Strong knowledge of cloud platforms, ideally Microsoft Azure.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Frontend development experience with React, TypeScript, or Node.js.
* Exposure to financial services or AI/ML frameworks.
* Advanced experience in Azure PaaS services and cloud-native design


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Fullstack Developer - Node
description:
**At Hemnet, we’re not just building Sweden’s leading property platform – we’re shaping how people find their future homes. Now we’re looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer who’s excited about Node, service oriented architecture, and making a real impact.** 
  

  

 👉 Last application day November 30th
   

  

**The Role** 
  

  

 You’ll join a cross-functional team where your voice matters. As a senior developer, you’ll not only write great code but also help drive architectural discussions, mentoring teammates, and helping us move towards a modern, flexible platform.
   

  

 We’re on a journey towards a service oriented architecture, and your experience here will be key. You’ll work hands-on with Node and React (while also touching Ruby) and bring ideas that push us forward.
   

  

**What You’ll Do** 
  

  

 The team is responsible for the authentication solution and is currently focusing on personalization for our users. In this role, you’ll
   

  

* Contribute to both backend and frontend development (Node.js, Nest.js, Ruby, React, GraphQL)
* Help shape our architecture as we move towards a service oriented architecture
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and fellow engineers
* Share knowledge and inspire the team and our communities
* Bring your personality and perspective to make the team stronger and more diverse


  

  

**Who You Are** 
  

  

 We believe you are experienced in working with Node and React, but also that you are open to learning Ruby. You enjoy guiding, coaching, and sparking great discussions as well as value collaboration, diversity, and creating smart solutions together.
   

  

* You have senior-level experience as a Fullstack Developer
* Experience working in Node.js
* You’re willing to learn Ruby
* You’ve worked with large-scale applications and know the challenges of breaking down a monolith into a service oriented architecture


  

  

**I am your new manager 👋** 
  

  

 Hi!
   

  

 My name is Staffan, and I’ll be your new manager. I’ve been at Hemnet since 2019 but just recently joined our domain called Consumers. I’m really excited to support the teams that will be working on many new and important areas for Hemnet – including personalization and smarter search features.
   

  

 My leadership style is listening, transparent, accessible, and supportive, while also challenging you to take your next step. Hopefully, we’ll learn a lot from each other and have plenty of fun as we break new ground at Hemnet. As a team, we get things done; we know when and where value can be added, and we’re clear on our priorities.
   

  

 Why did I decide to join Hemnet? I was strongly drawn to the culture and atmosphere – a wonderful combination of kindness, inclusiveness, and helpfulness, paired with high ambitions and a strong drive forward. My impression is that the people and the workplace together create the perfect foundation for you to do the best work of your career.
   

  

 At Hemnet, we believe tech is better when built together. If you want to shape not only code but also the future of Sweden’s most loved housing platform, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**A Note on Inclusion 💚** 
  

  

 At Hemnet, we believe that diversity in gender, sexual orientation, ability, neurodiversity, cultural background and life experience makes us stronger. We welcome applicants of all identities and backgrounds.
   

  

 If you meet many but not all of the requirements, we encourage you to apply. We value curiosity, a strong sense of purpose and the motivation to learn and grow, alongside your skills and experiences.
   

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: AI Software Engineer
description:
**ABOUT SINCH** 




 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses - including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others - rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
 



 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
 



 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
 



**DESCRIPTION** 




 We're seeking an experienced AI Software Engineer and skilled in Python, Java, and Kubernetes to join our data and analytics development team in Stockholm. In this role, you will be an integral part driving product development by adding AI/ML capabilities to the products that unlock valuable insights from traffic data, empowering mobile network operators and creating smarter customer solutions.
 


* Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models and data pipelines to extract and analyze insights from large-scale traffic data.
* Collaborate closely with product management to translate AI/ML requirements into actionable solutions and code, working alongside the team on implementation.
* Actively contributes to the development team, sharing knowledge and supporting team members, while learning from peers.



**REQUIREMENTS** 




 To ensure you can hit the ground running, we're looking for the following qualifications:
 


* Minimum 4 years of experience in software engineering, including 2+ years of hands-on practical experience building and deploying end-to-end AI/ML models.
* Proven ability to work independently and take full ownership of projects, including data pipelines, model evaluation, and performance tuning.
* Strong programming skills in Python and Java, with hands-on experience in Kubernetes.
* Proficiency in AI/ML libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, Pandas, and NumPy.
* Experience in Jupyter Notebook for data analysis.
* Familiarity with MLFlow is a plus.
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to guide and support team members through clear communication skills.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, or related field.



 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English** 
 .
 



 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we are not supporting relocation at this time.
 



 Applicants must:
 


* Hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship.
* Have a valid Swedish work permit.



**OUR HIRING PROCESS** 




 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
 



 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Low-code utvecklare inom AI
description:
**Lockas du av en arbetsplats där att ha roligt på jobbet, engagemang och professionalitet går hand i hand? Då är Nion platsen för dig!**
 Vi växer och är på jakt efter begåvade utvecklare som vill hoppa ombord på vår inspirerande färd mot framtidens mål. Med oss får du uppleva en gemenskap där vi prioriterar hållbarhet, utveckling och, framför allt, glädje på jobbet. Vår familjära kultur, kombinerat med en hög expertisnivå, skapar en unik arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Detta erbjuder vi dig:**
* Generösa förmåner, inklusive tjänstepension och bonusmöjligheter
* Kompetensutveckling
* Engagerande konferenser, teamaktiviteter, after works och hälsoinitiativ


 Som en del av vårt team kommer du arbeta nära både kollegor och våra värdefulla kunder. I rollen som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att ta dig an en spännande mix av uppgifter inom förvaltning, vidareutveckling och nyutveckling för en rad olika kunder. Denna mångfald skapar en dynamisk och varierande arbetsdag som ständigt erbjuder nya utmaningar.
   

  

 Som
 **Low-code utvecklare inom AI** 
 och processautomatisering är du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att digitalisera och effektivisera våra kunders processer genom intelligenta automatiseringar. Du utvecklar lösningar där AI-assistenter, Copilot-funktioner och automatiserade flöden samverkar för att skapa smarta och självlärande processer i Microsofts och IBMs plattformar.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Designa, bygga och underhålla automatiserade processer som integrerar AI-agenter, Copilot-funktioner och automatisering i Microsoft Power Platform och IBM WatsonX.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att utveckla lösningar i:
   

  

* Microsoft Power Platform – särskilt Power Automate, Power Apps, Power BI, AI Builder och Microsoft Copilot.
* IBM watsonx.ai, watsonx Orchistrator och watsonx Assistant.
* Skapa och konfigurera AI-assistenter som stödjer kundens i beslutsfattande, kundinteraktioner och informationshantering.
* Bygga automatiserade arbetsflöden där AI-komponenter tolkar text, bilder och data för att driva processer vidare (t.ex. via formulärtolkning, e-postanalys, röststyrning eller prediktioner).
* Samarbeta med verksamheten för att kartlägga processer som lämpar sig för AI-automation och ta fram proof-of-concepts.
* Integrera AI-lösningar med befintliga system via API:er och datakällor som Dataverse, SQL, SharePoint, Microsoft 365 eller IBM Cloud.
* Säkerställa att lösningarna följer riktlinjer för AI-governance, säkerhet och dataskydd (GDPR).
* Bidra till att utveckla organisationens strategi för AI-drivna automatiseringar och agentbaserade processer.


**Din profil:**
* Högskoleutbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap, datateknik eller motsvarande kompetens.
* + 6 års arbetslivserfarenhet som utvecklare


 Gedigen erfarenhet av Microsoft Power Platform, särskilt:
   

  

* Power Automate (processflöden och integrationer)
* Power Apps (användargränssnitt och logik)
* AI Builder (formulärtolkning, prediktioner, bildigenkänning)
* Microsoft Copilot (för verksamhetsstöd och AI-assistenter)


**Meriterande:**
* Erfarenhet av IBM:s AI- och automationsverktyg, särskilt:
* watsonx.ai och watsonx orchistrator
* IBM Business Automation Workflow (BAW)
* Förståelse för AI-agenter, NLP, machine learning, process mining och task mining.
* Erfarenhet av att integrera AI- och automatiseringslösningar via API:er, REST, JSON, Dataverse eller SQL.
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 Copilot och hur det kan användas för processstöd inom organisationen.
* Kunskap om AI-governance, datasäkerhet och ansvarsfull AI.
* Erfarenhet av RPA-verktyg som UiPath, Automation Anywhere eller Blue Prism.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga AI-drivna chatbotar eller virtuella assistenter.
* Kunskap om dataanalys och prediktiv modellering i Power BI, watsonx.ai eller liknande miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av agil utveckling (Scrum/Kanban) och samarbete i tvärfunktionella team.
* Erfarenhet av Azure AI Services och Azure OpenAI Service


**Meriterande certifieringar:**
* Microsoft Certified: Power Platform AI Specialist
* Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Developer Associate
* UiPath Certified RPA Developer


 Som individ värdesätter vi din förmåga att kommunicera, din ambition och ditt engagemang. Ditt självständiga driv och din flexibilitet gör dig till en ovärderlig del av vårt team.
   

  

**Vi är Nion**
 På Nion kombinerar vi teknisk spetskompetens med ett starkt engagemang för att hjälpa våra kunder nå framgång. Vi är stolta över att vara en flexibel partner på den digitala resan, där vi erbjuder både individuella specialister som förstärker kundens team och kompletta, välkoordinerade utvecklingsteam från våra interna enheter. Våra lösningar sträcker sig från avancerad affärsautomation och AI till skräddarsydd systemutveckling, stabil drift och support samt dataarkitektur och analys som omvandlar data till insiktsfulla beslut.
   

  

 Med över 250 skickliga konsulter och kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Oslo, Skopje och Bitola, har vi hjälpt företag världen över att växa genom innovation, samarbete och ett passionerat fokus på resultat. Våra kärnvärden –
 **samarbete** 
 ,
 **engagemang** 
 och
 **innovation** 
 – driver oss att ständigt leverera lösningar som gör skillnad, både för våra kunder och för våra medarbetare.
   

  

 Redo för nästa steg i karriären? Skicka in din ansökan idag!

title: ServiceNow Developer ITOM - Sweden, Stockholm
description:
**ServiceNow Developer ITOM (CSDM & CMDB) - Stockholm, Sweden - 6 months+** 




  





 Remote and onsite in Stockholm, Sweden
 



 6 months+
 



 ASAP start
 



  





 We are looking for a ServiceNow Developer with ITOM experience to join our customer's CMDB team and the design and enhancement of our Common Service Data Model (CSDM) and CMDB.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Experience with ITOM (Discovery, Service Mapping, Integrations)
* Develop and implement CSDM-aligned CMDB structures and relationships.
* Configure and manage Application Services, Business Applications, and Service Offerings.
* Support Discovery, Service Mapping, and integrations across other servicenow modules and discovery tool like ITOM and BMC Remedy.
* Develop scripts, workflows, and dashboards to improve data quality and automation.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive service visibility and data governance.



  





**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years of hands-on experience with ServiceNow ITOM
* Knowledge of CMDB and CSDM (v3.0 or later).
* Strong skills in JavaScript, Glide API, and ServiceNow configuration.
* Solid understanding of ITIL v4 and ServiceNow platform architecture.
* Experience in data modeling, CI class design, and CMDB health improvements.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills ,able to explain complex models in simple terms
* ServiceNow certifications (CIS–CMDB, CIS–Discovery, CSA) preferred.



  





 If this seems interesting to you please apply with your latest CV chloe.carr@next-ventures.com

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 3 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Familiarity with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE)


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Software Engineer (Java) - ZEOS Last Mile Delivery (all genders)
description:
****THE ROLE AND THE TEAM****
 Over the last years, we learned that solving fulfilment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in Partner Program and Connected Retail joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional fulfillment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 The ZEOS department is responsible for all partner-facing Zalando Logistics Solutions. By unifying and collaborating these services under a single umbrella, we provide a more holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfillment solution to meet our partners' needs and leverage common services to enable partner program growth.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer at ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing Europe’s leading Logistics Platform recently launched under the ZEOS Logistics brand, you will be part of a team working on designing technical solutions to connect various e-commerce platforms seamlessly with the robust logistics ecosystem of ZEOS.
   

  

 You will ensure that all our operational processes like warehousing, inventory management, inventory distribution, deliveries and returns can be steered on various e-commerce platforms. You will have the chance to learn about the broad business background we’re working with. In line with the overall Zalando philosophy you bring visibility and transparency to processes and thus have a huge impact on our customers and key stakeholders.
   

  

  

****INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN****
 If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every single requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!
   

  

 At Zalando, our vision is to be the leading pan-European ecosystem for fashion and lifestyle e-commerce – one that thrives on diversity and is truly inclusive by design. We believe that diverse teams fuel innovation and creativity, and we actively seek out talent from all backgrounds.
   

  

 We actively seek to reduce bias in our hiring and employment processes, focusing on your qualifications, skills, and contributions. To support this, we kindly ask that you refrain from including personal details such as your photo, age, or marital status in your CV, ensuring a fair and equitable evaluation based solely on your abilities and potential.
   

  

 We are committed to providing an exceptional and accessible candidate experience for everyone. If you require any accommodations to support you throughout the hiring process, please let us know – we are here to assist you.
   

  

 Discover more about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-culture/diversity-and-inclusion
   

  

  

****WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)...****
* Build and operate large-scale data streaming and processing applications serving fulfilment process relevant data with the latency of tens of milliseconds in magnitude to Zalando partners in using technologies such as Java, Postgres, and Elasticsearch.
* Use a state-of-the-art software development methodology.
* Be part of a newly established engineering team in Stockholm and help foster an environment of continuous learning.


******WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF...******
* 5+ years of experience as a Software Engineer with Java
* You understand microservice architecture, REST services and API design.
* Good understanding of distributed systems, Kafka
* Experiencing REST APIs with Spring Boot
* Familiarity with AWS, Kubernetes, and Postgres is a plus.
* "You build it, you run it" approach you have had your first experience in managing services end-to-end, from developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support
* Passion for working in an agile, cross-functional team, iterating quickly during the product development cycle. As well as the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with business stakeholders, product managers, and engineering peers.


****OUR OFFER****
 Zalando provides a range of benefits, please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.

title: Utvecklare Dynamics 365 F&O
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vill du vara en del av en av
 **Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser** 
 , enligt Great Place to Work? Sopra Steria är ett ledande IT-konsult- och managementbolag som flera år i rad har utsetts till
 **Karriärföretag** 
 och rankas av Gartner som en av de fem bästa inom Digital Transformation. Vi söker nu en driven utvecklare med erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 F&O för att förstärka vårt team.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 I rollen som utvecklare inom Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations kommer du att ansvara för att utveckla och integrera affärslösningar för våra kunder inom olika branscher. Du kommer att arbeta med att anpassa systemet efter kundernas specifika behov och integrera Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations med andra system för att säkerställa smidiga affärsflöden.
   

  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:**
* Utveckling och anpassning av funktionalitet i Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations med hjälp av X++ och C#.
* Skapande och hantering av integrationer med hjälp av Azure Integration Services för att koppla Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations med externa system.
* Design och implementering av integrationer via REST API för att möjliggöra sömlös kommunikation mellan olika plattformar och system.
* Delta i förstudier och workshops för att förstå kundens behov och krav samt bidra till lösningsdesign.
* Testning och validering av utvecklade lösningar för att säkerställa att de möter både funktionella och tekniska krav.


**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har minst 3 års erfarenhet som utvecklare inom Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations.
* Har goda kunskaper i X++, C# och Azure Integration Services.
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med integrationer mellan Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations och andra system via REST API.
* Har ett starkt intresse för att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som stödjer affärsprocesser och vill bidra med din expertis till innovativa projekt.


**Vad vi erbjuder:** 
 Hos Sopra Steria får du möjlighet att arbeta med några av de mest spännande kunderna och projekten på marknaden. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och stödjande arbetsmiljö där du får chansen att växa och utvecklas inom ditt område. Som en del av vårt Business Applications-team kommer du att samarbeta med erfarna kollegor som delar din passion för teknik och utveckling.
   

  

**Ansök:** 
 Om du vill vara med och forma framtidens affärslösningar och arbeta i en organisation som sätter sina medarbetare i fokus, skicka in din ansökan idag! För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Christer Söderholm på christer.soderholm@soprasteria.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Qliksense Developer
description:

 Sweden

 Stockholm

 Hybrid

title: Golang Developer
description:
We’re looking for a
 **Golang Developer** 
 to join our team at Ingrid. We are looking for someone who’s ready to take ownership, build great software, and grow together with a collaborative, small, and supportive team. You’ll work on backend systems that power Ingrid’s delivery experience platform that helps service-points and carriers make every delivery better.
   

  

 If you’re a hands-on developer who enjoys solving real-world problems with clean and efficient code, then this might be the perfect role for you.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, develop, and maintain backend services written in Go.
* Collaborate closely with product and customer-facing teams to translate needs into reliable technical solutions.
* Take ownership of features from design to deployment.
* Contribute to discussions about technical tradeoffs and architecture improvements.
* Continuously improve performance, scalability, and reliability.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Solid understanding of backend fundamentals and experience writing production-grade code in Go.
* You have 2+ years of professional software development experience and a degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent practical experience that’s helped you build a strong technical foundation.
* Familiarity with modern development tools and practices (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, version control, testing and cloud services like GCP/AWS).
* Willingness to occasionally contribute across the entire stack, working with codebases in TypeScript and React.
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* A team player who enjoys collaborating with their colleagues to solve complex problems and deliver value.
* A proactive, self-driven approach. You take ownership of tasks and see them through to completion.


**Who You Are**
 You’re curious, collaborative, and love to see your work make an impact. You enjoy working together with a team in a fast-moving environment where ideas turn into features quickly. You’re comfortable asking questions, taking initiative, and finding the balance between speed and quality.
   

  

**Why Ingrid**
 We’re on a mission to fix the delivery experience. Ingrid connects merchants, carriers, and consumers to create shopping journeys that are smooth, sustainable, and human.
   

  

 At Ingrid, you’ll find:
   

  

* A supportive, friendly team that values trust and autonomy
* Flexible work setup. Hybrid in Stockholm or Wroclaw
* Competitive compensation, wellness allowance, and pension plan
* Opportunity to work with modern tech and contribute to products that make a difference

title: ODI ETL developer
description:
Job Summary:
 



 We are looking for a results-driven ETL Developer with deep expertise in Oracle Data
 



 Integrator (ODI) and Teradata, along with hands-on experience in Azure Data Services and
 



 Databricks. The ideal candidate will be part of a cross-functional agile team, contributing to
 



 the design, development, and optimization of scalable data integration solutions in a SAFe
 



 Agile environment.
 



 Key Responsibilities
 



 • Design, develop, and maintain ETL pipelines using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI).
 



 • Write and optimize complex SQL queries in Teradata for large-scale data processing.
 



 • Build and orchestrate data workflows using Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and
 



 Synapse Analytics.
 



 • Collaborate with product owners, data architects, and business stakeholders to
 



 understand data requirements and deliver value incrementally.
 



 • Participate in PI Planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives as part of
 



 the SAFe Agile framework.
 



 • Ensure data quality, lineage, and governance across all data integration processes.
 



 • Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize ETL performance and reliability.
 



 • Maintain technical documentation and contribute to knowledge sharing within the
 



 team.
 



 Required Technical Skills
 



 • 5+ years of experience in ETL development using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI).
 



 • Strong expertise in Teradata including performance tuning and query optimization.
 



 • Proficiency in SQL, PL/SQL, and scripting (Shell, Python).
 



 • Experience with Azure Data Services: Data Factory, Synapse, Blob Storage.
 



 • Hands-on experience with Databricks and Apache Spark.
 



 • Familiarity with data modeling, data warehousing, and data lake architectures.
 



 Soft Skills
 



 • Strong communication skills – able to explain complex technical concepts to non-
 



 technical stakeholders.
 



 • Team player – thrives in collaborative environments and contributes to team success.
 



 • Proactive mindset – takes initiative to identify and solve problems before they escalate.
 



 • Adaptability – comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
 



 • Analytical thinking – strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
 



 • Continuous learner – stays updated with emerging technologies and best practices.
 



 Agile & SAFe Ways of Working
 



 • Experience working in Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) or similar Agile methodologies.
 



 • Familiarity with Agile ceremonies: PI Planning, Iteration Planning, Daily Stand-ups,
 



 System Demos, and Inspect & Adapt workshops.
 



 • Ability to work in cross-functional Agile Release Trains (ARTs) and contribute to
 



 Program Increments (PIs).
 



 • Comfortable using Agile tools like JIRA, Azure DevOps, or VersionOne.
 



 Preferred Qualifications
 



 • Certifications in ODI, Teradata, or Azure Data Engineer Associate.
 



 • Exposure to CI/CD pipelines, Git, and DevOps practices in data engineering.
 



 • Understanding of data security, compliance, and governance in cloud environments

title: Senior Game Developer - Paper.io2
description:
**About Voodoo**
 Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.
   

  

 This position can be Paris-based, Barcelona-based, Amsterdam-based, or fully remote within CET +/-2h.
   

  

 Team
   

  

 Our Gaming team is made up of hybrid-casual, casual, and mid-core experts. Our 'Core' games team supports internal and external studios worldwide in creating, developing, and launching new hit games, whilst our 'Live' games team focuses on delivering higher engagement on our existing and successful games.
   

  

 Joining our Live games team means collaborating with gaming industry experts on globally renowned, enduring games while embracing exciting new entrepreneurial ventures. With over seven billion downloads worldwide and a portfolio of more than 10 resilient hybrid games generating more than $20m per year, we are the world's largest and most successful hybrid publisher.
   

  

 You will be joining one of our Live Studios, working on
 **Paper.io 2** 
**.**
 With Paper.io 2, we’re building an iconic game that players will never forget!
   

  

 We're a small team of excellent people who take care of everything from ideas to testing, and we intend to grow while maintaining our high standards.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are looking for a talented Senior Game Developer with a good understanding of the casual mobile game market to help the team deliver fun, innovative, and entertaining features. You will take an innovative approach to gameplay ideas/features and give them their own spin.
   

  

* Responsibilities will align with your strengths
* Work on core gameplay improvements
* Develop new meta features
* Enhance and refine existing systems


 With this role, you will have a strong impact on the company by contributing daily to important decisions with a senior, multidisciplinary team of passionate and talented people. Flesh out the details of a game's design, oversee its testing, and revise the game in response to player feedback. Thanks to your creativity and your teamwork, let’s entertain millions of people with your hit games.
   

  

 Profile
   

  

* 5+ years of professional experience in C# and Unity
* Proven track record in successful mobile game development
* Exceptional expertise in a specialized area (e.g., animation, particle systems, shaders, architecture, performance optimization or networking) is a major plus
* Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on optimization and performance
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A creative, hands-on developer with a passion for quality work


**Benefits**
* Best-in-class compensation
* Other benefits according to the country you reside

title: Product Designer
description:
**Design The Future Of Delivery Experiences**
 At Ingrid, we design the platform layer that connects consumers, retailers, carriers, and partners to create seamless delivery experiences. From how merchants configure delivery options to how customers choose and track them, our tools sit at the center of a highly dynamic and distributed ecosystem.
   

  

 As a product designer here, you’ll work on challenges that live at the intersection of logistics, commerce, and human behavior—translating complex systems into intuitive, efficient, and scalable product experiences.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who brings both strong craft and high output. Someone who doesn’t just experiment with AI tools, but relies on them to expand creative range, iterate faster, and scale design work across surfaces and states.
   

  

 You’ll join a lean and collaborative product team—working closely with PMs, engineers, and two other designers—to shape the end-to-end product experience.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design intuitive product experiences across web and API surfaces—from configuration to customer-facing touchpoints
* Own problems end-to-end: from framing and exploration to prototyping, testing, and final UI
* Use AI-enhanced tools as a core part of your design workflow
* Contribute to and evolve our growing design system in Figma
* Collaborate tightly with engineers and PMs to ship with high velocity
* Help shape Ingrid’s design culture, rituals, and quality bar


**What We’re Looking For**
* 4–8+ years of experience designing digital products, ideally in SaaS or systems-heavy environments
* A portfolio that shows UX depth, systems thinking, and polished visual execution
* Demonstrated experience using AI tools in your workflow as a default—not a novelty
* A self-directed, pragmatic approach with sound judgment around depth vs. speed
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across disciplines
* Bonus: experience with design systems, developer-facing products, or configuration-heavy UIs


**Why Ingrid?**
 Ingrid powers the delivery experience layer for leading e-commerce brands like
 **NA-KD** 
 ,
 **Apoteket** 
 , and
 **Paul Smith** 
 . Our platform orchestrates the connection between retailers, carriers, consumers, and partners—enabling fast, flexible, and reliable delivery choices across Europe.
   

  

 You’ll join a product team that values autonomy, clarity, and craft. We prioritize learning fast, solving real problems, and designing systems that scale.
   

  

**Location & Ways of Working**
 This role is based in Stockholm, with a hybrid setup. While day-to-day presence at the office is not required, we value in-person collaboration and encourage regular face time with the team at our HQ.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send us your
 **portfolio** 
 and a short note about how AI tools are part of your design workflow. We’re excited to meet designers who are building with the future in mind.

description:
