title: UX designer med AI-fokus till Spiris
description:
*Är du UX-designern som ser värdet i AI och förvandlar det till upplevelser som användaren älskar? Drömmer du om att kombinera din UX-expertis med de senaste möjligheterna inom AI? Har du talang för att snabbt omsätta idéer till testbara koncept som skapar konkreta värden för användare? Då kan detta vara ditt nästa stora äventyr!*


På Spiris söker vi nu en UX-designer som vill vara med från start och forma hur AI kan skapa värde för våra kunder i våra produkter. Det är en chans att påverka, både för våra användare och för vår tekniska riktning.

**Vad kommer du att göra?**

* Designa och prototypa innovativa sätt som AI kan lösa våra kunders behov på – från idé till testbar lösning.

* Arbeta tätt tillsammans med utvecklare, produktägare och övriga UX-kollegor i ett agilt, snabbfotat team.

* Driva hela UX-processen: idé research prototyp test iteration.

* Bidra med visuell design när det behövs – även om fokus ligger på interaktion, funktionalitet och användarflöden.

* Faciliterar workshops och co-creationsessioner med användare och interna team.

**Vem är du?**

* Erfaren UX-designer med minst 3 års erfarenhet inom tech/SaaS.

* Van vid att självständigt navigera hela designprocessen.

* Erfaren av att jobba agilt och i nära samarbete med utvecklare och produktägare.

* Har arbetat med AI-relaterade produkter (chatbotar, prediktiva funktioner, automation) – eller är extremt nyfiken på att lära dig.

* Stark förmåga att snabbt gå från hypotes till prototyp.

* Utforskar och nyttjar smarta AI-verktyg i designprocessen


**Meriterande om du dessutom har:**

* Erfarenhet av mobilappdesign.

* Arbetat med “vibe design/coding”.

* Förstår tekniska möjligheter och begränsningar inom AI/ML.



Språk: Flytande svenska & engelska, i tal och skrift.

**Vi tror att du är en person som...**

* Tar initiativ, får saker att hända och tar ansvar för resultatet.

* Är innovativ och ser möjligheter där andra ser hinder.

* Har hög samarbetsförmåga och bygger goda relationer både internt och externt.

* Gillar att kombinera kreativitet med analys och strukturerade arbetssätt.

* Är nyfiken, prestigelös och bekväm med att arbeta i en miljö där förutsättningar kan ändras snabbt.

**Vad kan vi erbjuda?**

* Möjligheten att vara med från start i ett nytt team med stor innovationsfrihet.

* Projekt i teknisk framkant inom AI och molnlösningar.

* Kort beslutsväg, snabba iterationer och verklig påverkan på produkten.

* Flexibel hybridkultur – utgå från våra kontor i Växjö eller Göteborg.

* “My Competence Day” – dedikerade dagar för din utveckling.

* Möjlighet att starta eget företag parallellt med att arbeta hos oss.

* Satsningar på hälsa och välmående – aktiviteter för både knopp och kropp.



När vi frågar våra medarbetare varför de trivs säger de: kulturen, innovationsandan och utvecklingsmöjligheterna. Vi är stolta över att vara Karriärföretag 2025 och topp 10 mest attraktiva arbetsgivare för kvinnor inom IT.


Redo att bygga framtidens AI-lösningar med oss?  

  

Skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi hanterar urval och intervjuer löpande.

  

Tester och bakgrundskontroller förekommer som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.


För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta: Gustav Bergqvist – gustav.bergqvist@spiris.se

**Om Spiris**

  

Sedan 1984 har vi arbetat för att förenkla vardagen för Sveriges företagare. Under 2025 tar vi nästa steg och blir Spiris – tidigare Visma Spcs.  

  

Det markerar början på en ny era där vi satsar ännu mer på samarbete, innovation och utveckling. Vår mission är enkel: Förverkliga företagandet – och nu tar vi AI till hjälp för att göra den resan ännu smidigare.

title: Creative E-Commerce Designer
description:
Founded in 2018 and headquartered in The Netherlands, GT Ecom BV is on a mission to build the most efficient global direct-to-consumer infrastructure and become the world’s largest e-commerce company—powered by a collective of successful, scalable brands. By 2026, we’re aiming to achieve $500 million in revenue and operate over 50 thriving online stores worldwide.


With a team of 160+ top-tier remote e-commerce professionals across the globe, we blend local brand experiences with cross-border logistics, ensuring every customer feels connected—no matter where they are.


At our core, we value hard work, freedom with responsibility, constant improvement, and a mindset of positivity. We believe in building a high-performance, remote-first culture where honesty, excellence, and creativity drive everything we do—because the future of work is global, and we’re building it together.

 **The Upsides of Working with Us**


**Hard Work That Matters**


We’re surrounded by people who care deeply and give their best. We don’t settle for average—we show up, push boundaries, and aim high. That shared drive creates momentum and meaning in everything we do.


**Freedom with Responsibility**


You have the freedom to choose how, when, and where you work—but freedom only thrives when it’s paired with ownership. We trust you to manage your time, meet your commitments, and take responsibility for your impact.


**Constant Improvement**


Growth is part of our DNA. We believe in learning, evolving, and getting 1% better every day. Whether it’s a new skill, a fresh mindset, or sharper execution—stagnation isn’t in our vocabulary.


**Positivity by Default**


We approach people, problems, and communication with a positive mindset. That means giving the benefit of the doubt, staying constructive, and keeping energy high—even when challenges arise.


️ **Honesty & Transparency**


We believe the fastest way to move forward is through clear, honest communication. No politics. No guessing games. Just straight talk that builds trust and strengthens our team.


**Excellence Is the Baseline**


We hold ourselves and each other to a high standard—not out of pressure, but out of pride. We care too much about what we’re building to accept "good enough." Excellence is the expectation.


**Creativity Welcome Here**


We encourage bold ideas, fast testing, and open collaboration. Failure doesn’t scare us—comfort does. That’s why creativity is valued as a core ingredient in everything from product to process.

  

We’re searching for a **Creative Digital Experience Designer** to help shape how millions of people around the world interact with our brands online. You’ll transform ideas, stories, and campaigns into powerful, immersive experiences that captivate, convert, and inspire.


You’re not just designing for clicks — you’re designing for emotion, flow, and meaning.

  



**The Challenge**


We’re scaling dozens of digital brands across global markets — fast. Your mission: to make every storefront feel like its own world. From bold campaign concepts to seamless shopping journeys, you’ll merge creativity and strategy to bring our vision of world-class direct-to-consumer experiences to life.


This role is ideal for a **designer who loves both storytelling and systems** — someone who can craft visually stunning layouts, optimize user flows, and ensure that every design decision drives growth.

  

##### **A Day in the Life**

* Dream up and design **digital experiences that tell stories** — bringing campaigns, products, and promotions to life through compelling visuals and intuitive user journeys.
* Collaborate with marketing and growth teams to **transform ideas into interactive, conversion-focused experiences**.
* Use modern design tools and platforms (Shopify, Webflow, Figma, etc.) as your creative canvas to build and refine online experiences.
* Experiment, test, and iterate — continuously improving the visual and emotional impact of our digital touchpoints.
* Stay inspired by trends in design, culture, and technology — and bring fresh creative energy to every project.

 **Your Team When You Join Us**


You’ll join a diverse, global crew of creators, strategists, and marketers — all obsessed with building brands that matter. Reporting to the **Bulk Store Manager**, you’ll collaborate with an eight-member creative and marketing team dedicated to growing visibility and engagement across our portfolio of international stores.

**We would love to hear from you if…**

* 1+ year of experience in **digital design, UI/UX, or creative e-commerce** (Shopify, Webflow, or similar).
* A strong command of **visual design, layout, and brand storytelling** — backed by proficiency in tools like Figma, Adobe XD, or similar.
* Basic knowledge of **HTML, CSS, or front-end tools** to bring your designs to life (or an eagerness to learn).
* A creative portfolio that shows both **aesthetic flair and problem-solving power** — you think in systems, not just screens.
* An experimental, growth-oriented mindset — you’re comfortable trying, testing, and iterating fast.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit that thrives in a fully remote, global team.

 **Let’s Set Expectations First**

  

* This is **not** a salaried position. This is an **Independent Contractor role**.
* You must be able to commit at least 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week.
* We require everybody in the team to use Hubstaff (https://hubstaff.com/) to track hours worked.

**Compensation**

* We pay on an hourly basis.


If you are excited about the opportunity and feel like you are a good fit, we encourage you to apply today and talk to one of our recruiters. We look forward to seeing how your skills and experiences align with our vision.

title: Vikarierande UX-designer till Spiris
description:
*Är du en designmagiker som kan omvandla komplexa processer till användarvänliga upplevelser? Brinner du för att utforska och designa den bästa produktupplevelsen? Som dessutom gärna använder smarta verktyg för att nå dina mål? Då är du UX-designern vi letar efter!*


Att driva företag ska vara enkelt. Det är målbilden när vi utvecklar våra system och tjänster på Spiris. Nu söker vårt Product Experience-team en UX designer för ett föräldravikariat som vill vara med och stötta ett flertal olika produktteam i sitt arbete.

 **Vad kommer du att göra?**

* Samarbeta tätt med ett engagerat gäng produktägare, business analysts och utvecklare för att skapa lösningar som gör företagandet både lättare och roligare.
* Navigera genom kreativa processer, från analys och researcharbete till lansering och uppföljning.
* Teama med dina grymma UX-kollegor för att tillsammans hitta den bästa lösningen och se till att våra produkter blir så enhetliga som möjligt för våra användare

**Vem är du?**

* Du är en UX-designer precis i början av din karriär eller som eventuellt redan hunnit samla på dig ett par års erfarenhet, och precis som oss gillar att testa nya verktyg och metoder. Du brinner för att utmana både dig själv och oss, samt du vet att det är så vi tillsammans skapar bästa möjliga effekt.
* Du har erfarenhet av research, design av SaaS-produkter och att designa responsiva webbapplikationer.
* Du har en passion för kundinsikt och att föra användarnas röst vidare i utvecklingsprocessen.
* Du är grym på att utveckla koncept och visualisera flöden med goda kunskaper i Figma som verktyg.
* Som person är du kreativ, idérik men också en doer som fokuserar på att få saker på plats.
* Du älskar att djupdyka i data för att identifiera trender och mönster i användares beteende.
* På ett inspirerande sätt presenterar och argumenterar du för dina designval.

**Vad kan vi erbjuda?**

* Möjligheten att utvecklas tillsammans med entusiastiska kollegor i ett av Sveriges ledande SaaS-bolag som jobbar i teknisk framkant, och som dessutom är en del av Europas största tech-koncern. Vi är stolta över att ha blivit utnämnda till Karriärföretag 2025 och topp 10 intressanta arbetsgivare för kvinnor inom IT!
* En hybridkultur som erbjuder dig flexibilitet i din vardag, där du har möjligheten att jobba från något av våra härliga kontor eller delvis på distans.


När vi frågar våra medarbetare varför de trivs hos oss brukar de flesta svara företagskulturen, engagemanget bland kollegorna i kombination med möjligheterna att utvecklas. Hos oss får du arbeta med omkring 500 kollegor på en arbetsplats med massvis av möjligheter!


Känns det spännande? Då vill vi gärna jobba med dig!

**Vi väntar på din ansökan!**  

Önskar du mer information om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Johan Björnegård Edetoft, johan.bjornegard@spiris.se


Vi kommer att genomföra urval och kalla till intervjuer löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är 16/11. Vi tillämpar tester och bakgrundskontroller som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.

**Om oss på Spiris**

*Sedan 1984 har vi arbetat för att förenkla vardagen för företagare. Under 2025 tar vi nästa steg och blir Spiris – tidigare Visma Spcs.*

*Det markerar starten på en ny era där vi satsar ännu mer på samarbete, innovation och utveckling. Med Spiris vill vi göra din företagarvardag ännu enklare och mer inspirerande.*

*Vi på Spiris har gjort det till vårt uppdrag att minimera krånglet för Sveriges företagare och redovisningsbyråer. Vår mission – Förverkliga företagandet – handlar i grund och botten om att göra det enklare för dig att starta, driva och utveckla företag.*

title: Product Designer
description:
**Design the Future of Delivery Experiences**


At Ingrid, we design the platform layer that connects consumers, retailers, carriers, and partners to create seamless delivery experiences. From how merchants configure delivery options to how customers choose and track them, our tools sit at the center of a highly dynamic and distributed ecosystem.


As a product designer here, you’ll work on challenges that live at the intersection of logistics, commerce, and human behavior—translating complex systems into intuitive, efficient, and scalable product experiences.


We’re looking for someone who brings both strong craft and high output. Someone who doesn’t just experiment with AI tools, but relies on them to expand creative range, iterate faster, and scale design work across surfaces and states.


You’ll join a lean and collaborative product team—working closely with PMs, engineers, and two other designers—to shape the end-to-end product experience.

**What You’ll Do**

* Design intuitive product experiences across web and API surfaces—from configuration to customer-facing touchpoints
* Own problems end-to-end: from framing and exploration to prototyping, testing, and final UI
* Use AI-enhanced tools as a core part of your design workflow
* Contribute to and evolve our growing design system in Figma
* Collaborate tightly with engineers and PMs to ship with high velocity
* Help shape Ingrid’s design culture, rituals, and quality bar

**What We’re Looking For**

* 4–8+ years of experience designing digital products, ideally in SaaS or systems-heavy environments
* A portfolio that shows UX depth, systems thinking, and polished visual execution
* Demonstrated experience using AI tools in your workflow as a default—not a novelty
* A self-directed, pragmatic approach with sound judgment around depth vs. speed
* Strong communication and collaboration skills across disciplines
* **Bonus:** experience with design systems, developer-facing products, or configuration-heavy UIs

**Why Ingrid?**


Ingrid powers the delivery experience layer for leading e-commerce brands like **NA-KD**, **Apoteket**, and **Paul Smith**. Our platform orchestrates the connection between retailers, carriers, consumers, and partners—enabling fast, flexible, and reliable delivery choices across Europe.


You’ll join a product team that values autonomy, clarity, and craft. We prioritize learning fast, solving real problems, and designing systems that scale.

**Location & Ways of Working**


This role is based in Stockholm, with a hybrid setup. While day-to-day presence at the office is not required, we value in-person collaboration and encourage regular face time with the team at our HQ.

**How to Apply**


Send us your **portfolio** and a short note about how AI tools are part of your design workflow. We’re excited to meet designers who are building with the future in mind.

title: UI Design Intern
description:
ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions is part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. Every day, we reimagine how people move through a safer, more open world with ease. If you've ever walked through an automatic door, stayed in a hotel, or gone through passport control, you've probably used one of our products or services. We have operations in over 70 countries, with over 63,000 colleagues around the world.
   

  

 Our expertise in customer journey mapping, innovation, and service design leads to the invention of new solutions that create value for our clients and exceptional experiences for their end users. And we have a fantastic opportunity available in Vingcard for a UI Design Intern.
   

  

 Part of Global Solutions, Vingcard specialises in electronic locking and access management systems for the global hospitality industry. We create seamless, secure experiences for hotels and their guests through innovative digital solutions that blend security with exceptional user experience.
   

  

 As the UI Design Intern for Vingcard, you will have the opportunity to shape the visual identity of access management platforms used by thousands of hotels worldwide, whilst developing professional skills in interface design and learning from experienced design professionals.
   

  

 Working closely with our Design Lead, you will support the creation of polished, visually compelling interfaces that enhance usability and maintain brand consistency across our product ecosystem.
   

  

**What You Will Do…**
* Craft polished, visually compelling interfaces with attention to typography, colour, spacing, and interaction states that align with our brand identity
* Transform wireframes and UX flows into high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes that demonstrate visual design solutions
* Partner with UX designers to ensure visual solutions enhance usability and support the intended user journey
* Apply and evolve our visual language across different platforms whilst maintaining brand integrity
* Support developers in ensuring design integrity during implementation, providing detailed specifications and assets
* Stay current with UI trends and techniques, bringing fresh perspectives to our design approach
* Contribute to accessible design practices, learning WCAG requirements and inclusive design principles


**What We Expect Of You…**
* Currently enrolled in a programme with LIA (Lärande i arbete) placement requirement
* Studying Digital Design, Visual Communication, Interaction Design, or related field
* Portfolio is a must! (We understand you may not have worked on company projects yet; school assignments, personal experiments, or any work that shows your design thinking is welcome)
* Proficiency in Figma (Required)
* Understanding of typography, colour theory, layout, and visual hierarchy principles
* Basic awareness of accessibility principles and designing for diverse user needs
* Curiosity about design systems and component-based design approaches
* Attention to detail and willingness to iterate based on feedback
* Collaborative attitude, strong communication skills, and eagerness to learn
* You will ideally be located in Stockholm or surrounding areas, comfortable with hybrid work (3 days/week in office)


**Plus If You Have…**
* Familiarity with Cursor or similar AI-assisted design tools
* Interest in design systems and component libraries
* Basic understanding of front-end technologies (HTML/CSS)


**What You Can Expect From Us…**
* Mentorship & Learning: Direct guidance from our Design Lead and experienced design professionals in a supportive team environment
* Real-World Impact: Work on products used by hotels and guests worldwide, seeing your contributions go live
* Career Development: Access to design resources, tools, and training to expand your skills and maximise your potential
* Collaborative Culture: Supportive and accessible leadership team with a solid values platform that underpins who we are and how we operate
* Flexible Working: Hybrid arrangement balancing office collaboration with remote flexibility


**Application**
 You can submit your application by clicking 'Apply Now'. A portfolio is mandatory for consideration (any format accepted: online, PDF, presentation, etc.). If password-protected, please provide access details.
   

  

 We will not consider applications received via email or through other channels. We will review applications continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**About Us**
 Featuring four times in Forbes' most innovative companies worldwide, we deliver innovative, safe, and convenient security solutions that provide real added value to our customers. As a group, our goal is to help billions of people every day experience a more open world. We're proud to boast leading positions across the majority of Europe, North and South America, Asia, and Oceania, offering products and services to customers seeking solutions to their entrance and opening requirements, such as locks, doors, and entrance automation.
   

  

 We are building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.
   

  

 For questions about the role or process, contact Moreno Nourizadeh, moreno.nourizadeh@assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: UX Desin Intern
description:
ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions is part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. Every day, we reimagine how people move through a safer, more open world with ease. If you've ever walked through an automatic door, stayed in a hotel, or gone through passport control, you've probably used one of our products or services. We have operations in over 70 countries, with over 63,000 colleagues around the world.
   

  

 Our expertise in customer journey mapping, innovation, and service design leads to the invention of new solutions that create value for our clients and exceptional experiences for their end users. And we have a fantastic opportunity available in Vingcard for a UX Design Intern.
   

  

 Part of Global Solutions, Vingcard specialises in electronic locking and access management systems for the global hospitality industry. We create seamless, secure experiences for hotels and their guests through innovative digital solutions that blend security with exceptional user experience.
   

  

 As the UX Design Intern for Vingcard, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the user experience design of access management platforms used by thousands of hotels worldwide, whilst developing professional skills in research, interaction design, and strategic thinking. The role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Working closely with our Design Lead, you will support user research, create user flows and wireframes, and learn how UX decisions connect to business goals and user needs in the hospitality technology space.
   

  

**What You Will Do…**
* Create user journeys, wireframes, and interactive prototypes in Figma that solve real problems for hospitality professionals
* Conduct user research and usability testing, learning to turn insights into actionable improvements
* Design user flows and interfaces for our digital services, understanding how structure supports user goals
* Collaborate on information architecture, learning to organise content and navigation in ways that make sense to users
* Contribute to design strategy workshops and sprints, understanding how UX decisions connect to business goals
* Document design rationale, user personas, interaction patterns, and research findings to support team decision-making
* Participate in design critiques and usability testing sessions, developing your understanding of user-centred design practice

* Proficiency in Figma (Required)

* Analytical thinking and curiosity about why users behave as they do
* Ability to articulate design decisions and receive constructive feedback
* Comfortable working with ambiguity and iterating on solutions
* Strong communication skills, collaborative mindset, and eagerness to learn
* You will ideally be located in Stockholm or surrounding areas, comfortable with hybrid work (3 days/week in office)


**Plus If You Have…**
* Interest in accessibility and inclusive design practices
* Experience with user research methods or usability testing
* Experience working with Miro for collaborative workshops and ideation


**What You Can Expect From Us…**

* Collaborative Culture: Supportive and accessible leadership team with a solid values platform that underpins who we are and how we operate
* Flexible Working: Hybrid arrangement balancing office collaboration with remote flexibility


**Application**
