**About Us**
 Featuring four times in Forbes' most innovative companies worldwide, we deliver innovative, safe, and convenient security solutions that provide real added value to our customers. As a group, our goal is to help billions of people every day experience a more open world. We're proud to boast leading positions across the majority of Europe, North and South America, Asia, and Oceania, offering products and services to customers seeking solutions to their entrance and opening requirements, such as locks, doors, and entrance automation.
   

  

 We are building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.
   

  

 For questions about the role or process, contact Moreno Nourizadeh, moreno.nourizadeh@assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Product Designer - H&M Regional Relevance
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are looking for an experienced Senior Fashion Designer to join our Regional Assortment department with a focus on campaigns for collections across the world. This position will be based in our Head office in Stockholm but will require some travel to different regions from time to time.
   

  

 As a Designer for Regional Relevance, you will focus on creating collections for our different regions that require special attention to tailor our collections to suit the relevant target customer. As a Product Designer you will work closely with our teams in both Stockholm and regional to achieve this. You will set extended visual goals based on our main collection and will plan the assortment on a concept level together with the Regional Relevance Manager and Design Lead. You will be working with a wide assortment along with key fashion drops and local campaigns.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 As a Senior Designer you will work alongside our Lead Designer and will be part of a wider team of Designers, Product Developers, Planners, Pattern Makers, and a Product Manager.
   

  

 We are looking for Designers who love to collaborate, work in a team, and provide our diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion level with commercial awareness! It will be key also to keep a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while maintaining a cost-conscious awareness throughout the design process.
   

  

 This is an amazing opportunity to collaborate with our fashion conscious, forward thinking global team. There will also be opportunities to travel along the way.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Designer with....
   

  

* A minimum of a BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion/Textile Design.
* 3+ years’ work experience as a Designer.
* Background from an aspirational global brand or retailer.
* International experience would be advantageous.
* High attention to detail with strong knowledge on Womenswear products.
* A creative mindset with a sharp eye for both current and future trends.
* Strong customer focus and commercial mindset for H&M´s global womenswear customer.
* Experience working closely with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe.
* Strong skills in and used to working in Adobe Creative Suite programs.
* 3D CLO is advantageous.
* Demonstrated communication skills and a true collaborative team player.
* Independent, driven & proactive with “one step ahead” mindset.
* Organized & structured, able to set priorities and follow timelines.
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast-moving & growing industry.
* Experience or a desire to coach Junior Designers would be beneficial.
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary).


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 This is a full-time position is based in Stockholm. You will report to the department Assortment Designer
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV and relevant portfolio work (pdf max 10mb/uploading). All documents should be in English.
   

  

 For internal candidates: please remember to always speak with your current manager when applying for an internal role. Please know that if you are currently permanently employed, you will keep this base employment status while taking on a temporary role.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


 The journey starts here

title: Digital Designer
description:
Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 Are you a digital designer with a passion for creating captivating designs that drive measurable growth? Do you thrive at the intersection of creativity, strategy, and innovation? At Digital Fans, part of the Nord DDB family, we’re looking for a Growth Digital Designer to join our team in Stockholm and help shape the future of our presence in the Nordics.
   

  

**About Us**
 At Digital Fans, we combine creativity and technology to craft digital marketing strategies that deliver real results. With expertise in growth marketing, UX/UI design, and automation, we help brands stand out and succeed in an ever-evolving digital world. As a part of Nord DDB, one of the leading creative agencies in the Nordics, we work at the forefront of innovation to craft impactful campaigns for renowned brands like McDonald’s, Allianz, Vattenfall and more.
   

  

 The role
   

  

 As our Growth Digital Designer, you’ll play a crucial role in creating visually compelling, data-driven designs that elevate campaigns and directly impact business growth. Combining your skills in UX/UI design, motion graphics, and strategic thinking, you’ll create campaigns and content that resonate with audiences and exceed client expectations.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Design and implement creative solutions and digital assets for campaigns, ensuring consistency and quality.
* Bring designs to life with engaging motion elements for dynamic content.
* Develop automation-optimized content, leveraging tools like Figma, Celtra, and After Effects.
* Collaborate with strategists and developers to align designs with growth objectives and data-driven insights.
* Partner with clients to understand their needs and deliver standout solutions.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

* Proven experience as a digital designer, with a portfolio showcasing design and motion work.
* Proficiency in Figma, with familiarity in tools like Celtra, Bannerflow, and Adnami being a strong plus.
* A creative and growth-oriented mindset, with the ability to deliver on data-led insights.
* Strong UX/UI design skills, paired with an ability to think strategically about how design impacts growth marketing.
* Ability to thrive in a collaborative, hybrid work environment.


 Why join us?
   

  

* Be a part of something big: Help establish Digital Fans in the Nordics while working alongside Nord DDB’s renowned creatives.
* Inspiring projects: Work with exciting clients on campaigns that challenge the status quo.
* Professional growth: Opportunities to develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive, innovative team.
* Dynamic environment: A dynamic, collaborative environment that values bold ideas and experimentation.


 Ready to join us?
   

  

 If you’re excited to bring your talent and creativity to Digital Fans, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now by sending your CV, portfolio, and a short introduction to careers@digitalfans.se. Let’s create something extraordinary together.

title: Intern - Graphic Design
description:
**About SoScale**
 At
 **SoScale Media** 
 , we’re on a mission to scale brands through high-performing content rooted in creativity, performance data, and platform fluency. We blend bold ideas with a sharp performance mindset to deliver UGC and ad strategies that don't just look great — they convert. We’re fast-growing, culture-driven, and relentlessly focused on results. Our values shape how we work:
   

  

**Extreme Ownership** 
 – We don’t wait. We take initiative and own outcomes.
   

  

**Profit** 
 – We make work that works. For our clients, and for our business.
   

  

**Above & Beyond** 
 – We over-deliver, bringing passion and extra to every brief.
   

  

**Relationships** 
 – We move as a team, lead with empathy, and care deeply.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Graphic Design Intern at SoScale, you’ll contribute to the creation of static and motion assets for ads and UGC campaigns. You’ll support senior designers on everything from layout tweaks to fresh concept visuals — always with performance and results in mind. If you’re passionate about design, detail-oriented, and hungry to learn, this role is your springboard into creative production.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 Support the design of ad creatives, graphics, and layouts.
   

  

 Adapt brand assets into platform-native visuals (TikTok, Meta, etc.).
   

  

 Collaborate with designers, editors, and strategists on campaigns.
   

  

 Learn design systems, workflows, and tools like Figma and Adobe.
   

  

 Take feedback constructively and grow your visual craft every week.
   

  

**💼 What We Offer**
 The chance to work with the next generation of bold, fast-growing DTC brands
   

  

 A seat at one of Stockholm’s most ambitious performance content agencies
   

  

 Hybrid setup with a creative, central office in Vasastan, Stockholm

title: Creative Strategy & Design Director
description:
Are you a strategic thinker who lives at the intersection of design, creativity, and digital growth? Do you thrive on turning data into actionable insights, leading high-performing teams, and helping brands scale in a fast-moving digital landscape?
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Creative Strategy & Design Director** 
 to cover parental leave—someone who can guide both creative and strategic vision across our client work. In this role, you’ll partner with our data strategist and our design team to lead projects that drive real business outcomes. You’ll shape the strategy, direct the creative (with a strong design lens), and ensure every deliverable ladders up to bold, measurable growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Strategic Direction: Translate client goals and data insights into clear, actionable creative strategies that lead to growth.
* Design Leadership: Oversee design execution across projects, ensuring quality, clarity, and alignment with strategic objectives
* Client Growth Strategy: Define and lead digital growth strategies for clients across platforms, products, and campaigns.
* Pitch Leadership: Build compelling pitch decks and present ideas to high-level clients with confidence and insight.
* Creative Oversight: Provide direction and feedback to design team.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 8+ years of experience in creative or design strategy, with a strong digital and growth focus.
* Proven ability to bridge data insights and creative execution.
* Deep understanding of digital platforms, growth marketing, and design systems.
* Strong client-facing skills and a collaborative, solutions-first mindset.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and storytelling abilities.


 Why join us?
   

  

* Collaborate with a diverse, talented team that values creativity and purpose.
* Work on impactful projects for ambitious clients in a variety of industries.
* Help shape brand and digital growth strategies from the ground up.


 This is a parental leave cover running from mid-August to March, with the possibility of extension.
   

  

 Excited to make a real impact?
   

  

 We’d love to hear from you. Send your CV, portfolio, and a short introduction to careers@digitalfans.se and let’s create something extraordinary together.

title: Senior Product Designer - Stockholm, Sweden
description:
**Mission**
 The mission of Speechify is to make sure that reading is never a barrier to learning.
   

  

 Over 50 million people use Speechify's text-to-speech products to turn whatever they're reading – PDFs, books, Google Docs, news articles, websites – into audio, so they can read faster, read more, and remember more. Speechify's text-to-speech reading products include its iOS app, Android App, Mac App, Chrome Extension, and Web App. Google recently named Speechify the Chrome Extension of the Year and Apple named Speechify its 2025 Design Award winner for Inclusivity.
   

  

 Today, nearly 200 people around the globe work on Speechify in a 100% distributed setting – Speechify has no office. These include frontend and backend engineers, AI research scientists, and others from Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, leading PhD programs like Stanford, high growth startups like Stripe, Vercel, Bolt, and many founders of their own companies.
   

  

**What Yo** 
**u'** 
**ll Do**
* Pitch, prototype, test, build, ship, and refine new features
* Refine our UX/UI patterns across our iOS and Android apps
* Rethink our onboarding and core user flows
* Influence the product roadmap
* Refine our process and help shape the design org


**An Ideal Candidate Should Have**
* Experience: You can demonstrate work that includes research, discovery, prototyping, and delivery of consumer-facing products across multiple platforms
* Product thinking: You understand strategy and can articulate what and why as equally as how. You embrace analytics and work side-by-side with PMs to pinpoint key opportunities
* Customer-centricity: You're comfortable talking with customers and know how and when to use their feedback in the design process
* Collaboration: You know how to inspire, play, and negotiate with opinionated PMs, engineers, and execs
* Craft: You're skilled at typography, information design, and micro-interactions. You're curious about audio. You understand what's feasible in iOS, Android, and the browser
* Communication: You're articulate and able to explain your ideas at various resolutions. You ask just as many questions as you answer. Your writing reflects the same attention to detail as your design
* Focus: We're a high-growth startup with a busy, remote team. You know how and when to engage or be heads down


**What we offer**
* A dynamic environment where your contributions shape the company and its products
* A team that values innovation, intuition, and drive
* Autonomy, fostering focus and creativity
* The opportunity to have a significant impact in a revolutionary industry
* Competitive compensation, a welcoming atmosphere, and a commitment to an exceptional asynchronous work culture
* The privilege of working on a product that changes lives, particularly for those with learning differences like dyslexia, ADD, and more
* An active role at the intersection of artificial intelligence and audio – a rapidly evolving tech domain


**Think you're a good fit for this job?**
 Tell us more about yourself and why you're interested in the role when you apply.
   

  

 And don't forget to include links to your portfolio and LinkedIn.
   

  

**Not looking but know someone who would make a great fit?**
 Refer them!
   

  

**Speechify is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.**
 Speechify does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Game Designer
description:
**Why you want to be a Game Designer at Chief Rebel**
 We offer a platform for you to shape the player's journey through dungeons, carefully designed layouts, epic boss fights, and engaging enemy encounters. This is an opportunity to make an impact by taking ownership of handcrafted levels, designing memorable boss battles, and crafting challenging enemy encounters. As a Game Designer at Chief Rebel, you will have the chance to showcase your skills in level design while also contributing to other aspects of game design, such as boss and enemy encounters. However this role will mostly focus on Dungeons.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Game Designer focusing on Dungeons to join us! This role is a temporary position, running until August 2026.
   

  

 As a skilled Game Designer at Chief Rebel, you will be at the forefront of creating remarkable game levels and encounters. Your expertise in level design, including layout, boss battles, and enemy encounters, will be instrumental in shaping our gameplay experiences. Collaborating closely with the environment team, artists, animators, programmers, and game director, you will lead the charge in translating our envisioned levels and encounters with great replayability. Your proficiency in level design, storytelling, and player guidance will set the bar for excellence.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Taking a proactive role in designing and building immersive levels, boss battles, and enemy encounters in collaboration with Feature Teams.
* Developing onboarding elements and tutorials to enhance the player experience.
* Applying UX principles to ensure exceptional player engagement, readability, and enjoyment.
* Maintaining a satisfying flow and pacing throughout combat scenarios and boss battles.
* Collaborating closely with the environment and gameplay team to create cohesive aesthetics, ambiance, and memorable encounters.
* Making a significant impact on the overall appeal and impact of the game through your handcrafted levels, boss battles, and enemy encounters.


**Skills Needed**
 To excel as a Game Designer at Chief Rebel, you should possess the following skills and qualifications:
   

  

* Passion for cooperative gameplay and a solid understanding of MMOs, MOBAs, or ARPGs.
* Extensive experience and expertise in level design, with a strong emphasis on fulfilling the player's fantasy and guiding them through the experience.
* Proven track record in scripting, navmeshes, lighting, and designing boss and enemy encounters.
* Proficiency in developing onboarding elements and designing effective tutorials.
* Advanced knowledge of player engagement, pacing, and storytelling techniques.
* Keen attention to detail, ensuring exceptional readability, immersion, and an enjoyable player experience.
* Previous experience in shipping games and a deep understanding of the game development process.


**Application**
 To apply, please submit your resume and portfolio.
   

  

**About Chief Rebel**
 Chief Rebel is a game development studio located in Stockholm, Sweden. We make stylized games with deeply involved mechanics. www.chiefrebel.com
   

  

 Chief Rebel is a game development studio located in Stockholm, Sweden. Our studio exists to craft incredible, stylized games with deeply involved mechanics; providing thousands of hours of entertainment for our players. That's all.

title: Design Lead (B2B)
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
**Firstly, a Bit About The Team**
 We're the team behind Arrive's B2B business — one of the company’s fastest-growing and most strategically important areas. As B2B Design Lead, you’ll help shape products that solve real-world problems for businesses managing fleets and mobility at scale.
   

  

 Our mission? To become the trusted global mobility partner that boosts productivity and satisfaction through efficient and sustainable solutions. Whether it's streamlining parking expenses for SMBs or building data-powered platforms for enterprise fleets, we’re on a journey — from simplifying today’s admin to enabling tomorrow’s ecosystem of mobility services.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 The B2B Design Lead at Arrive takes a strong and holistic ownership of the end to end user experience that’s under the remit of the department they’re working in.
   

  

 This role entails a mix of leading a small team as well as hands-on contributions to raise the bar on the quality of the experiences offered to Arrive's users.
   

  

 As B2B Design Lead you’ll report directly to the Head of Product Design and will collaborate closely with senior stakeholders in product, engineering and design, to shape the next steps of how the products should look, work and feel moving forward.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Through close collaboration with key stakeholders, ensure that the user experience of Arrive's products are the best they can possibly be.
* Coach, support and collaborate with a small, distributed team of skilled product designers to set both them and the department up for success. This includes spending time in 1:1’s, working with recruitment, onboarding new joiners, as well continuously improving ways of working, processes and overall maturity of design within the department.
* Whilst you’ll work with a team of designers, you’re also expected to have solid hands-on skills that you don’t mind leveraging with relative frequency. Your craft is at a level where you have an ability to truly elevate the quality of the products from a design standpoint.
* Aside from working with cross functional collaborators across the department, you’ll also work frequently with others in the wider organization: e.g. designers, UX researchers, UX writers and the design system team.


**What You’ll Bring To The Team**
* We expect you to have at least 5+ years of experience in design with 3+ years of lead/management/coaching experience.
* Solid experience working with cross functional teams, preferably in a product/SaaS context.
* We expect you to be a strong communicator in both written and verbal form.
* Track record of product-thinking, outcome-centric, high quality projects.
* Impeccable craft skills. Know-how in design tools and prototyping is a given. Understanding for or skills in UX research, UX writing, motion design, design systems, are seen as beneficial.


 We expect you to share an outstanding portfolio, giving a sense for your track record of shipping excellent products.
   

  

**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile, YourParkingSpace and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Tele2 is looking for a full-stack developer to complete our team, Digital Sales, in the B2C IT Engineering department.
   

  

 Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.
   

  

 Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**This is the job**
 At B2C IT Engineering you will be a key-player in building and perfecting our sales- and service systems. Our goal as a pioneer is to build the smartest and fastest sales system in telco. To achieve this we work with the fastest technology, experiment a lot and put a lot of effort into understanding our users and their needs. We are continuously delivering and improving on sprint basis.
   

  

 As a person you understand the big picture and are willing to learn new things - and you are always ready to walk the extra mile to ensure a high-quality product. The daily job will include contact with several different teams and departments, and we believe you have excellent collaboration and communication skills. As a person, you are open, driven and are not afraid to take own initiatives.
   

  

**This Is What You Have**
* Strong background as a full-stack developer with 3–5 years of experience
* Core skills: TypeScript, React, Astro and Node.js
* Experience and/or strong interest in cross-platform design, design systems, and shared components
* Proven track record in projects involving complex business logic
* Fluent in both Swedish and English
* Possibility to work at our head office in Kista, Stockholm, three times a week


**Who are you?**
* A team player who enjoys contributing from start to finish alongside the team
* Comfortable working in a mature agile environment and thrives in it
* Curious, open-minded, and driven to continuously develop and improve
* Enjoys supporting and mentoring others in the team with their growth
* Motivated to explore new technologies and stay at the forefront of innovation
* Values close collaboration and actively participates in mob and/or pair programming daily

title: (Senior) DevOps Engineer (m/f/d) for ERP systems
description:
We are a specialty vaccine company that develops, manufactures, and commercializes prophylactic vaccines for infectious diseases addressing unmet medical needs. We take a highly specialized and targeted approach, applying our deep expertise across multiple vaccine modalities, focused on providing either first-, best- or only-in-class vaccine solutions.
   

  





**Responsibilities** 




 As Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our cloud ERP system (including validation activities). You will be responsible for developing, implementing, validating, and maintaining robust quality assurance processes and procedures to guarantee the functionality, performance, and usability of our ERP solutions. Working closely with cross-functional teams on a global level, you will identify areas for improvement, drive quality initiatives, and champion best practices throughout the development lifecycle.
 



 Your main tasks includes:
 


* Develop, implement, and maintain automated testing tools for ERP and Cloud systems to enhance testing efficiency.
* Design and manage CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps.
* Create and execute test cases, scripts, and validation protocols (IQ/OQ/PQ) for system functionality, performance, and compliance.
* Analyze test results, track and resolve defects, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure quality outcomes.
* Develop and document validation strategies aligned with regulatory standards (FDA, GxP, GAMP) and company policies.
* Review and approve validation documentation, ensuring accuracy and regulatory compliance.
* Stay current with industry trends, support audits, and contribute to continuous improvement of ERP QA processes.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field


* Minimum 3 years of experience in IT systems engineering
* Strong knowledge of ERP systems and experience with testing tools and methodologies (SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, Azure DevOps, API testing, CI/CD, Jira, Confluence)
* Proficiency with automated testing frameworks (e.g. Selenium, RSAT)
* Experience in pharmaceutical industry is an asset (validation principles, regulatory standards)
* Excellent analytical, documentation, and troubleshooting skills with high attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


**Benefits**

 Working with Valneva means being part of a 
 **global biotech company** 
  with a clear vision to make a meaningful 
 **impact in the world** 
 . At Valneva, you can expect a dynamic and 
 **innovative** 
  work environment characterized by an open, appreciative company culture and exciting, 
 **impactful assignments** 
 . Enjoy the benefits of 
 **flat hierarchies** 
 , an international atmosphere, and regular company events that foster 
 **collaboration** 
 and connection.
 



 Additionally, we offer:
 


* **Work Life Balance:** 
  Flexitime & Compensation days
* **Financial perks:** 
 Performance-related bonus & Lunch vouchers
* **Lifelong learning:** 
  Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning
* **Health & Wellbeing:** 
  Free access to sports and fitness activities via myClubs & Office Massages



  

 Join us and shape the future of biotechnology! Please send your CV in English!
   

*Due to legal reasons we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 60.000 gross per year based on full-time employment. However our salaries are market oriented and in line with your qualifications and experience.*

title: Java developer
description:
*Digpro är en stor innovatör inom geografisk IT och även marknadsledande i Skandinavien. Vi tillhandahåller lösningar för el, telekom, gas, fjärrvärme, vatten samt stat och kommuner - i själva verket alla organisationer som bygger och underhåller olika sorters nät. Vi är fler än 100 anställda på tre olika kontor, där alla arbetar på ett unikt sätt för att göra geografiska data och kartsystem mer flexibla och effektiva.*
**The Digpro mission is to be the compass for smart society infrastructure and to support our customers in their aim to maximize the knowledge and control of their network. To succeed in this mission an understanding of the customer needs and the tools we develop is crucial. Our belief that diversity inspires innovation guides us in our development routines as well as in our recruitment process. Our values bring us together and help us in our efforts to contribute to stronger and more durable utilities and societies in the future.**
**We are searching for a java developer to join our team at Digpro’s headquarters in Stockholm. We’re expanding to new markets and investing more than ever in our products – we need your help to succeed. Our products support essential public services and have a long life span which requires high quality and a special focus on the maintainability of the code.**
**About The Job**
 As a java developer at Digpro you are part of a team dedicated to develop and maintain the products and modules assigned to the team. You work closely together with other developers and collaborate with other roles such as product owners, UX-designers, testers and technical writers.
   

  

 Your day to day work will include programming, time estimations, designing technical solutions, code review and technical documentation. Digpro is a growing company, aiming to find scalable solutions for both products and processes, you will be a part of this exciting transformation.
   

  

 As you gain experience in our technical stack, architecture and our products, you will also gain responsibilities within technical areas of the code and applications as well as responsibilities in mentoring junior colleagues.
   

  

 You will
   

  

* Be developing and maintaining systems for important societal functions
* Create integrations with other systems
* Be part of a supporting and inventive team
* Perform time estimations for development tasks
* Do code reviews and automated unit tests
* Write technical documentation and “Howtos”
* Demonstrate developed features
* Be part of the third line technical support


 We are looking for you who have:
   

  

* A curious and positive attitude
* A relevant education in computer science.
* Good knowledge in Java and SQL
* Experience of Java Swing is an advantage
* Good theoretical foundation in your programming skills
* Analytics skills and knowledge of algorithms and data structures
* An open mind regarding new ideas, needs, requirements and opportunities in a changing world
* Interest in constructive discussions regarding opportunities and solutions together with several different stakeholders


**What We Offer**
 At Digpro, you will get the opportunity to build a meaningful career with meaningful products. No matter your role, you will be a part of a highly professional and welcoming team.
   

  

 We are an established tech company with a startup spirit. What does this mean? Well, we have a lot in common with tech startups: we love complex programming, we play ping-pong during breaks, and we all help shape our company culture as it evolves. But we also offer something extra you don’t always find at startups - stability. Our processes are in place, experienced colleagues are at hand when you need advice, and we all appreciate a good traditional Swedish “fika”.
   

  

 For the role, probationary employment is applied. To give you the best possible onboarding, both socially and professionally, we would like to recommend working on-site as much as possible. This is in our bright and airy office at Kungsholmen in Stockholm.
   

  

 The role may involve work on projects that require security clearance from the Swedish Security Service / SÄPO.
   

  

 You are welcome to send in your application with CV and personal letter by clicking on the ad or via our career page at Digpro.com.
   

  

 Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Start date: Autumn 2025

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI** 




 As
 **Senior Android Engineer** 
 you’re a part of a cross functional team with highly skilled Backend, Mobile, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Analysts, Designers and Product professionals. The team owns the development and delivery of tools and features that empower our fleet specialists to operate efficiently, from intelligent routing to operational workflows. The team helps ensure smooth fleet operations and high service quality. Your responsibility is to build features that engage and empower our users. This will include:
 


* Analysing business requirements, designing and developing high-performance, innovative and useful features together with your team.
* Ensuring high level of architecture, quality, usability and maintainability of the components and code.
* Participating in all aspects of product development from detailed programming to high-level system design. You will be the Android expert in the team, while also contributing to data analytics and backend development, embracing a truly cross-functional role.
* Keeping up to date with the latest trends in Android development.
* Testing cutting-edge techniques and tools to level up mobile development at Voi.



**WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK** 




 Except having an interest in staying up to date on Android development, we believe the right person has:
 


* 3+ years of experience building native Android applications in Kotlin, with strong understanding of modern Android architecture and patterns, including Jetpack Compose and common frameworks in the ecosystem.
* Ability to communicate technical ideas clearly and effectively.
* Experience writing well-structured, testable, reliable, efficient and easily maintainable code.
* A track record of working in empowered product teams, where you help shape what to build, not just how. You take end-to-end ownership and care deeply about the user experience and business impact.
* Experience in additional engineering areas beyond mobile development, for example frontend or backend is a strong merit.



**WHY VOI?** 




 Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal Voiage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:
 


* Join Europes #1 micromobility company.
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation.
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal.
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution.
* Work from our dog-friendly office in Stockholm.

title: Fullstack Developer – Sustainable Tech
description:
Do you want to be part of a leading European company that accelerates the transition toward a sustainable society? Then we can offer you a job as a Full-Stack Developer in a modern workplace with challenging tasks and exciting projects at AFRY Global Business Applications!
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Full-Stack Developer, you will, together with a devoted team, be responsible for developing business-critical applications and integrations on our journey to achieve operational excellence. The way of working is based on agile development methods and team spirit. You collaborate closely within your team and cross-functionally with other teams consisting of Developers, Business Analysts, Architects, testers, and the Team Lead.
 



  





 You will work with modern microservices-based applications in a Microsoft environment using C# and .NET. We have a well-formulated architecture that is based exclusively on various Azure components and is designed for scalability and flexibility. We are also passionate and proud to continuously work towards improving Sustainable IT across AFRY and the world.
 



  





 The team’s primary focus is to build and enhance internal applications and integrations within the HR domain, specifically concerning various aspects of the staff journey. The team platform is built on Modern .NET Core and React with Redux. In your role as a Full-Stack Developer, we expect you to grasp the backend challenges but also have an interest in usability, to achieve the best possible experience for end-users.
 



  





**About You** 




 Naturally, you have an interest in and passion for Software Development!
 



  





 To succeed in this role, you thrive when you get a lot of personal responsibility and the opportunity to influence. You have the ability to see both details and a holistic perspective in the solutions that you and your team work on and you are comfortable in expressing and motivating your ideas and suggestions. You also have a genuine interest in problem-solving and are an outcome-oriented problem-solver.
 



  





 In addition, we expect you to be passionate about sustainable IT solutions and great architecture.
 



  





 Tech Knowledge We Appreciate:
 


* Solid programming skills in .NET Core and C#
* Experience with microservices architecture
* Experience around Azure cloud and infrastructure as code
* Comfort working with SQL and databases
* Background as a full-stack developer or similar experience
* Previous work with frontend technologies such as React or similar frameworks



  





*"We believe that change happens when people with brave ideas come together"* 




  





**Additional Information** 




 Our core values, brave, devoted, and team players, explain our people and is the glue of our culture. It also says a lot about who we are looking for. If you join the AFRY team, you will quickly get a lot of responsibility as you show your capabilities. At AFRY, we have a lot of competent colleagues. The hope is that there will be an exchange of knowledge and innovation where we all can grow together.
 



  





 In Addition to This, We Offer the following:
 


* A hybrid workplace solution
* 33 days of vacation + holiday on the 23rd of December
* Work-life balance
* Access to a wide range of activities through our social club: Club AFRY, such as Hackathons, yoga, restaurant visits, and more
* Competitive benefits regarding pension, health care, and parental leave
* Company discounts with external partners through our benefits portal Benify
* Wellness allowance 4500 SEK/year
* Learning days
* Restaurants and cafés on site (location dependent)



  





*AFRY is collaborating with Safemind for this recruitment.*

title: Utveckla framtidens digitala lösningar för vård och omsorg - exjobb hos Inera
description:
Framtidens välfärd formas av nya idéer och perspektiv - därför söker vi nu mastersstudenter inom datateknik som vill göra sitt examensarbete hos Inera!
   

  

 Vi vill ta del av din kompetens och dina tankar kring hur vi kan vidareutveckla vårt digitala ekosystem och skapa samhällsnytta på nya sätt. Som exjobbare hos oss får du arbeta med tekniskt avancerade och samhällsrelevanta frågor som gör skillnad på riktigt - samtidigt som du får inblick i en organisation som står i centrum för Sveriges digitalisering av vård och omsorg.
   

  

**Varför göra ditt exjobb hos oss?**
 Som exjobbare på Inera får du:
   

  

* Bidra till samhällsnytta genom att utveckla nya lösningar inom e-hälsa, digital infrastruktur och samhällskritiska tjänster.
* Samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med kollegor från it och digital arkitektur till medicinsk sakkunskap och juridik.
* Stöd av erfarna handledare som guidar dig genom hela exjobbsprocessen.
* Arbeta i en innovativ miljö där teknik, utveckling och samhällsengagemang står i fokus -och där dina idéer kan bli verklighet.


**Exempel på exjobbsområden**
 Inom affärsområdena Verksamhetstjänster samt 1177 och Kunskapstjänster erbjuder vi spännande och tekniskt utmanande exjobb, bland annat:
   

  

* Post-kvantumkryptografi (Verksamhetstjänster)
* Underskrift – EIDAS paket 2 (Verksamhetstjänster)
* Digital plånbok och användning i företagsvärlden (Verksamhetstjänster)
* Användning av AI kopplat till Ineras statistiktjänst (Verksamhetstjänster)
* UX kopplat till portal och appar (Verksamhetstjänster)
* Invånares behörigheter och företrädare (1177 och Kunskapstjänster)


 Vi tar emot två exjobbare (alternativt fyra om projekten genomförs i par).
   

  

 Exjobben är inte avlönade, men ger värdefull erfarenhet, möjlighet till teknisk fördjupning och chansen att bygga kontakter inför framtiden.
   

  

**Träffa oss på vår exjobbskväll!**
 I slutet av november bjuder vi in till Ineras exjobbskväll – en kväll där du får:
   

  

* träffa våra handledare,
* höra mer om våra exjobbsområden, och
* diskutera hur ditt exjobb kan bidra till utvecklingen av digitala välfärdstjänster.


 Anmäl dig här!
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vi söker engagerade mastersstudenter inom datateknik, medicinskteknisk, it eller digitalisering.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Skicka in ditt CV samt en kort beskrivning av vilket ämne du är intresserad av - och hur du utifrån dina perspektiv skulle vilja angripa frågeställningen. Vi välkomnar även egna idéer inom ovanstående områden.
   

  

 Efter urvalet får du möjlighet att träffa våra handledare – och ta en kaffe med Dan Bergvall, sektionschef inom Verksamhetstjänster eller Hanna Emami sektionschef inom 1177 och Kunskapstjänster, för att prata vidare om ditt exjobb.
   

  

**Har du frågor?** 
 Kontakta hr@inera.se

title: Chef Kundupplevelse till Apotek Hjärtat
description:
**Så här jobbar du som Chef för Kundupplevelse på Hjärtat**
 Som Chef för Kundupplevelse har du en central roll i att forma hur våra kunder upplever Hjärtat – både digitalt och i butik. Du leder ett team av specialister inom CRO, kundanalys och UX/UI-design, och ser till att vi förstår våra kunder på djupet. Du arbetar nära andra delar av organisationen för att driva utveckling som gör skillnad i hela kundresan. Tillsammans med ditt team skapar du lösningar som bygger lojalitet, stärker varumärket och ökar försäljningen.
   

  

**Dina Uppgifter Handlar Bland Annat Om Att**
* Leda och utveckla kundupplevelseteamet och skapa förutsättningar för ett datadrivet arbetssätt.
* Samla in, analysera och sprida kundinsikter internt.
* Utveckla och förbättra kundresor över alla kanaler.
* Stötta utvecklingsprojekt med kundinsikter och lösningsdesign.
* Ansvara för design och utveckling av Hjärtats digitala ytor samt efterlevnad av tillgänglighetsdirektiv (WCAG)
* Vara ambassadör för kundinsikt och identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter.


**Är du den vi söker?**
 Du är en engagerad och kommunikativ ledare som drivs av att skapa struktur och tydliga arbetssätt som förbättrar både kundupplevelse och affär. Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö med mycket samarbete, där du har förmågan att se möjligheter och hitta lösningar. Med din analytiska- och strategiska förmåga kan du prioritera utifrån insikt, effekt och genomförbarhet. Du leder med tydlighet och får med dig andra i förändring och utveckling.
   

  

**Vi Tror Att Du Har**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av kundinsikt och kundupplevelse, gärna inom e-handel.
* Relevant akademisk examen.
* Dokumenterad ledarerfarenhet och tidigare personalansvar.
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändringsarbete med hjälp av agila metoder och processer.


  

  

**Hitta hem hos oss**
 På Hjärtat har vi ett fantastiskt uppdrag: vi hjälper människor att må bättre. Vi finns för alla i Sverige – för de sjuka och för de friska, genom livets alla faser. Med 400 apotek i hela landet och en e-handel som aldrig stänger, finns vi alltid nära. Vi är över 4000 kollegor som tillsammans möter våra kunder med omtanke, var de än befinner sig. Tillsammans bygger vi en kultur där vi är ett lag som litar på varandra, ser varandras förmågor och där alla kan bidra och påverka. Där vi alltid utgår från vårt samhällsuppdrag och där det finns plats för nya idéer och innovation. För oss är det viktigt att ta vara på våra medarbetares kunskap och tankar och vår hemvist i ICA Gruppen ger stora möjligheter till både personlig och yrkesmässig utveckling. Här finns en plats för dig med Hjärtat på rätt ställe.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 På Hjärtat strävar vi efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka. Vi välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund! Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag 15/11, skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå arbetspsykologiskatester och bakgrundskontroller innan anställning. All extern hjälp med rekrytering undanbedes.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid eller enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse.  Har du frågor om tjänsten kontakta Daniel Norén, daniel.noren@apotekhjartat.se, för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Sanna Smidvik, sanna.smidvik@ica.se.

title: Systemtekniker GIS – Inriktning Applikationer och DevOps
description:
Länsstyrelsernas IT-avdelning är i en spännande utvecklingsfas där digitalisering, innovativa lösningar och säkerhets- och beredskapsfrågor är i fokus.
  
  

Vår IT-miljö är omfattande och varierande. Den innefattar allt från modern infrastruktur till system som vi utvecklar själva. Framför allt kommer våra idéer hela samhället till nytta. Det ger en alldeles speciell känsla som är svår att slå.
  
Länsstyrelsernas verksamhet har en stor bredd och verkar inom områden som är högst aktuella i dagens samhälle. Digitalisering är en stark drivkraft för länsstyrelserna där IT ofta har en nyckelroll i att realisera behoven.
  
  

Länsstyrelsernas IT-avdelning är nationell och jobbar för samtliga 21 länsstyrelser i Sverige.
  
  

Lockas du av att arbeta som systemtekniker inom GIS-applikationer och samtidigt göra verklig samhällsnytta? Vill du ingå i ett engagerat och kompetent team där samarbete och kunskapsdelning är nyckeln till att lösa komplexa problem och skapa effektiva lösningar? Vi söker dig som är systemtekniker med erfarenhet och intresse för GIS, eller en GIS-ingenjör med starkt tekniskt driv och kunskap inom systemdrift och DevOps.
  
  

Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

I rollen ansvarar du för den tekniska driften och förvaltningen av våra GIS-applikationer och plattformar. Du bidrar till att säkerställa en stabil, säker och effektiv leverans av GIS-tjänster som används av samtliga 21 länsstyrelser i Sverige. Tjänsten omfattar leverans och förvaltning av GIS-byggblock som används vid utveckling av applikationer med geografisk funktionalitet. IT-tjänsten tillhandahåller både webb- och klientbaserade komponenter, såsom verktyg och kodbibliotek, som möjliggör utveckling av GIS-applikationer i low-code- och pro-code-lösningar. Exempel på komponenter: ArcGIS Experience Builder, återanvändbara API: er, m.fl.
  
  

**I din roll kommer du att:**  

* Utveckla och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för effektiv driftsättning av GIS-applikationer.
* Ansvara för teknisk drift, underhåll och support av GIS-applikationer.
* Felsöka applikationer med hjälp av webbläsarverktyg (t.ex. Chrome DevTools).
* Kontrollera och kvalitetssäkra kod inför driftsättning.
* Installera och konfigurera GIS-programvara samt integrera GIS-lösningar med andra system.
* Arbeta i nära samarbete med kollegor i ett team med god sammanhållning, där digitala möten är en naturlig del av vardagen.


Du får möjlighet att arbeta i en tekniskt avancerad miljö med moderna GIS-lösningar och banbrytande teknologier. Rollen är flexibel och kan utvecklas över tid i takt med verksamhetens behov.
  
  

Kvalifikationer
  
  

**Du har:**  

* Högskoleutbildning inom GIS alternativt arbetsrelaterad erfarenhet som anses likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av drift av GIS-plattformar som Esri ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Server, GeoServer, QGIS, Safe FME Flow.
* Erfarenhet av teknisk IT-drift (applikationer i servermiljö).
* Stark förmåga att felsöka och debugga system och applikationer.
* Erfarenhet av databashantering i SQL Server, PostgreSQL/PostGIS.


**Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av:**  

* Arbete i en DevOps-miljö med automatisering av bygg- och leveransprocesser genom CI/CD-pipelines.
* Programmering i Python, Javascript/Typescript, PowerShell, Bash, C#.
* Windows Server- och Linux-miljöer.
* Drift av Java-applikationer.
* Containerisering och molnplattformar.
* Infrastruktur som kod (t.ex. YAML).


Personliga egenskaper
  
  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:**  

* Har ett analytiskt och lösningsorienterat arbetssätt.
* Är kommunikativ och kan dokumentera samt förklara tekniska processer tydligt.
* Har ett öga för detaljer och strävar efter hög kvalitet.
* Är initiativtagande, självgående och arbetar proaktivt.
* Trivs i teammiljö och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap.
* Förespråkar DevSecOps-principer och integrerar säkerhet som en naturlig del av utvecklings- och leveransprocessen.


Vi fäster stor vikt vid den personliga lämpligheten och ser det som självklart att du bidrar till ett gott arbetsklimat.
  
  

Vi tror på allas lika möjligheter och ett av våra huvuduppdrag är att verka för mångfald och en personalsammansättning som speglar länens befolkning.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
**Du ansöker till jobbet via denna länk:** https://lansstyrelsen.varbi.com/se/what: job/jobID: 872570/
  
  

Bra att veta
  
  

Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och interna utbildningar finns för att stödja din professionella utveckling.
  
  

Läs mer om oss på vår webb https://www.lansstyrelsen.se/vastra-gotaland/om-oss/jobba-hos-oss/jobba-pa-it-avdelningen.html. Vi finns också på https://se.linkedin.com/company/lansstyrelsernas-itavdelning
  
  

Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhetsmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras innan vi fattar beslut om anställning. För en del anställningar kan därför svenskt medborgarskap komma att krävas. Läs mer om säkerhetsprövning https://se.linkedin.com/company/lansstyrelsernas-itavdelning
  
  

Länsstyrelsen är en beredskapsmyndighet och har ett särskilt utpekat ansvar under kris och krig/höjd beredskap.
  
  

Din ansökan blir en allmän handling när du söker tjänster hos oss. Därför är det viktigt att du med skyddade personuppgifter inte registrerar dig via vårt rekryteringssystem. Posta din ansökan till HR-enheten, Länsstyrelsen Västra Götaland, 403 40 Göteborg. Delge inte några känsliga uppgifter i din ansökan men ange någon form av kontaktuppgift så att vi kan kontakta dig om du är aktuell för tjänsten. Vid frågor, ta kontakt med HR via e-post hr.vastragotaland@lansstyrelsen.se

title: IT-supporttekniker med erfarenhet av serverhantering och nätverk
description:
Om rollen
  
Vi söker nu en erfaren IT-supporttekniker som vill bli en del av ett engagerat team till en av våra kunder. Här kommer du kommer att arbeta med att ge support till användare, felsöka problem och säkerställa att IT-miljön fungerar optimalt. Rollen innebär både daglig användarsupport och arbete med mer avancerade tekniska lösningar.
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**  

Ge support till användare via telefon, mail och ärendehanteringssystem.
  
Felsöka och åtgärda problem i hårdvara, mjukvara och nätverk.
  
Hantera och underhålla servrar och nätverksmiljöer.
  
Delta i förbättringsprojekt och bidra till utvecklingen av IT-infrastrukturen.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Har minst 3 års erfarenhet av IT-support eller liknande roll.
  
Har arbetat med serverhantering och nätverk i tidigare uppdrag.
  
Har goda kunskaper i felsökning och problemlösning.
  
Är kommunikativ och trivs med att hjälpa användare.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Erfarenhet av Active Directory, Microsoft 365 och virtualiseringslösningar.
  
Kunskap om IT-säkerhet och backup-lösningar.
  
  

Det här är ett konsultuppdrag via oss på Gigstep. Du kommer inledningsvis bli anställd av oss för att på sikt gå över och bli anställd av företaget direkt.
  
Om det låter som att det är dig vi söker, bra! Vi jobbar med löpande urval, så skicka in ditt CV med engång.

title: IT-tekniker (Second Line) till Consat Data!
description:
Consat är ett teknikbolag och har snart i 40 år hjälpt företag att utvecklas genom högkvalitativa tekniska lösningar. Trots att koncernen idag finns globalt har Consat lyckats behålla en entreprenöriell kultur med korta beslutsvägar, stark lagkänsla och en tydlig satsning på medarbetarna.
  
Consat Data är en del av koncernen och består av cirka 14 medarbetare med kontor i Partille. Här arbetar vi nära våra kunder och tillsammans skapar vi IT-miljöer som är stabila, moderna och säkra.
  
Hos oss blir du del av en kultur där kunskap delas, idéer välkomnas och utveckling är en självklarhet.
  
Varför du ska jobba hos oss
  
En trygg arbetsgivare utsedd till Karriärföretag 13 år i rad
  
En välkomnande och prestigelös kultur där du får påverka och utvecklas
  
Chans att arbeta brett med allt från klientdrift och servermiljöer till nätverk och moln
  
Kort väg från idé till beslut. Hos oss får du vara med och forma lösningarna
  
Interna karriärvägar och möjlighet att nischa dig
  
  

Om tjänsten
  
Som IT-tekniker inom Second Line blir du en viktig del av vårt team som ansvarar för drift, support och vidareutveckling av kundernas IT-miljöer. Du arbetar med flera kunder parallellt, ofta långsiktigt, och får en varierad vardag där ingen dag är den andra lik.
  
Ditt arbete omfattar både fjärrsupport och kundbesök, och du får möjlighet att arbeta med ett brett teknikspann, från traditionell serverdrift och nätverksinfrastruktur till Microsoft 365-policyarbete, säkerhet och modern molnförvaltning.
  
En viktig del av rollen är att vara kundansvarig, att förstå kundens behov, driva förbättringsinitiativ och säkerställa en trygg och framtidssäkrad IT-miljö. Du blir kundens tekniska partner, och följer arbetet från rekommendation till genomförande och drift.
  
För att trivas i rollen är du är en lösningsorienterad och serviceinriktad person som gillar att arbeta nära kunder och bygga relationer. Du är självgående, strukturerad och trygg i att prioritera när flera saker händer samtidigt. Med ett brett teknikintresse och en nyfiken inställning tar du dig an varierade uppgifter och trivs i en miljö där du får ta ansvar, tänka själv och bidra med idéer. Du kommunicerar tydligt, samarbetar gärna med kollegor och uppskattar att vara en del av ett team där man hjälper varandra och delar kunskap.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

**Du kommer bland annat att:**  

Ge Second Line-support och teknisk problemlösning
  
Drift- och underhåll av servrar, nätverk och klientmiljöer
  
Konfiguration och optimering av Microsoft 365-miljöer och policies
  
Arbeta kundnära genom att följa upp, rekommendera förbättringar och driva åtgärder
  
Säkerställa licenshantering, säkerhetsnivåer och backup-lösningar
  
Prioritera och planera din egen vardag från snabba ärenden till större projekt
  
Utföra installationer och on-site arbete hos kund
  
  

**Vi söker dig som uppfyller följande:**  

Flera års erfarenhet av en liknande roll
  
Erfarenhet av Windows-miljöer och Windows Server
  
Erfarenhet av Active Directory
  
God kunskap inom nätverk och brandväggar
  
Erfarenhet av Office 365 / Microsoft 365-administration
  
Goda kunskaper inom hårdvara och kringutrustning (installation, felsökning och support)
  
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska
  
B-körkort
  
  

**Meriterande är om du har:**  

Erfarenhet som IT-konsult
  
Erfarenhet av Mac / Linux
  
  

Fortsatt intresserad av rollen?
  
Vad kul! Då får du mer än gärna ansöka med ett CV så hör vi av oss för ett eventuellt nästa steg i processen.
  
Den här rekryteringsprocessen administreras av Job Solution Consulting, och kunden har begärt att alla frågor angående tjänsten hanteras av Job Solution Consulting. För eventuella frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att höra av dig till mig. Du når mig på fredrik.hovstadius@jobsolution.se
