title: EIB Trainee - Information Systems Directorate - Collateral & Market Data Management Unit - based in Luxembourg
description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and require regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment.
   

  

 The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for
 **Information Systems Directorate (IS) – Business Solutions Department (BSD) - Finance Division (FD) - Collateral & Market Data Management Unit (C&M),** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg:
 **TRAINEE**
***Duration: 5 months (fixed start date:***
***1st March/April 2026)***
***(With possible extension up to 6 months if required by University)***
***Please note that, as marked on our Webpage, only applications from nationals of the Member States of the European Union, as well as citizens from countries that have been officially granted candidate status to join the EU, can be considered (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Serbia, Turkey and Ukraine).***
***Candidates whose Erasmus+ programme overlaps with the duration of the traineeship will not be considered.***
***Please note that you are requested to limit your applications to a maximum of three traineeship publications. We will only consider and retain the first three applications submitted.***
 Objective of the traineeship
   

  

**The Objective Of This Traineeship Is Twofold**
* First, to contribute to the continuous improvement of the automated testing landscape in the market data domain within the bank. Key focus will be on the increase of automated testing coverage (by adding new asset types to the existing scope), technical evolution and optimisation of the existing testing infrastructure, and support with the definition of robust processes around automated test scheduling, executing, monitoring, and reporting.
* Second, to enhance operational intelligence for decision making by integrating machine learning techniques and tools for model training and predictive analytics in the market data domain, leveraging on the bank's large market data sets.


**Responsibilities**
 You will support the automation of market data testing:
   

  

* Review and enhance existing test cases and scripts in close collaboration with project and operational resources on IT and business side.
* Create new test cases and scripts together with subject matter experts.
* Improve existing technical testing infrastructure (using Python, Azure DevOps, Kafka, and REST), guided by an internal solution architect.
* Support refinement of automated test procedures and reporting in collaboration with a specialized test and defect manager.


 Furthermore, You Will Contribute To The Initial Setup Of (predictive) Market Data Analytics In Close Collaboration With Internal IT Staff (leveraging On Internal Tooling Or Amazon Web Services Services)
   

  

* Establish a scalable data pipeline to ingest, process, and analyse large volumes of market data, suitable for robust model training, to gain analytics insights.
* Apply machine learning techniques tailored to market data to gain predictive insights and allow market behavior forecasting.
* Support operationalization of predictive analytics workflows by embedding model outputs into decision making.


**Academic Qualifications And Professional Skills**
* Final year of studies or University degree in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, or a related field.
* Demonstrated experience in machine learning and (big) data analytics would be an advantage.
* Knowledge of Python and SQL, standard data analytics packages utilising Python, Kafka, REST, Azure DevOps would be an advantage.
* Knowledge of market data (bond prices, FX & interest, volatilities) would be an advantage.
* Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

 Find out more about
 **EIB core competencies** 
 here
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorized disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Traineeship Recruitment team hr\_traineeship\_recruitment@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

**Your Application May Be Used For Another Campaign.**
**Please note that deadline for application is on the November 18th, 2025.**
***More information on our***
***EIB Traineeship Programme***
***and***
***Provisions for In-service training***
***can be consulted on our EIB website;***
 https://www.eib.org/en/about/careers/categories/traineeship-and-graduate.htm

title: EIB Trainee - Projects Directorate - Energy Office Division - based in Luxembourg
description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and require regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment.
   

  

 The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its
 **Projects Directorate (PJ) - Energy & Environment Department (E2D) - Energy Office Division (ERGO)** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg:
 **TRAINEE**
***Duration: 5 months (fixed start date: 1st March/April 2026)***
***(With possible extension up to 6 months if required by University)***
***Please note that, as marked on our Webpage, only applications from nationals of the Member States of the European Union, as well as citizens from countries that have been officially granted candidate status to join the EU, can be considered (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Serbia, Turkey and Ukraine).***
***Candidates whose Erasmus+ programme overlaps with the duration of the traineeship will not be considered.***
***Please note that you are requested to limit your applications to a maximum of three traineeship publications. We will only consider and retain the first three applications submitted.***
 Objective of the traineeship
   

  

 The Energy Office in the Energy and Environment Department is enhancing its capacity to manage, analyse and monitor information related to environmental, climate and social (ECS) aspects, as well as procurement activities, across EIB operations. To strengthen evidence-based decision-making and resource deployment, and to support the Division’s analytical work, efforts are underway to consolidate data, streamline project appraisal and reporting, and explore innovative tools for data analysis. The Division aims to improve how project-related ECS, geospatial and procurement information is collected, structured, and visualized, facilitating more efficient tracking of key indicators and trends. In parallel, the team is exploring the potential of emerging technologies, including artificial intelligence, to support the review and analysis of documentation in a rigorous and responsible manner. It is also considering how to enhance document housekeeping and management in a way that enables for quick retrieval, analysis and, where feasible, generation of reports / briefings.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Map and integrate data sources related to Environment, Climate, Social and Procurement, support the design of a coherent and standardised framework for project-level data tracking that facilitates effective resource management and identifies key operational needs.
* Contribute to the development of interactive dashboards and visual analytics that translate complex datasets into clear, evidence-based insights on trends, supporting decision-making and strategic planning.
* Explore and test AI-assisted approaches for country profiles, gap analysis (e.g. between national frameworks and EIB standards), document analysis, helping the team assess how artificial intelligence can be applied rigorously, credibly, and responsibly to the project due diligence tasks in the energy and water sector.
* Promote data and AI literacy by sharing methodologies, tools and lessons learned with colleagues, contributing to the Division’s broader knowledge base and innovation culture. This may include developing a data base of rigorous prompts and creating agents. It will involve working closely with experts to understand needs.


**Academic Qualifications And Professional Skills**
* Final year of studies or University Degree (preferably Master’s) ideally in one of the following fields: Data Science, Information Management, Statistics, or Computer Science or in Environmental or social Sciences, engineering or business field that included modules data science, information management, statistics.
* A demonstrated interest in sustainable finance, environmental and social governance (ESG), or public procurement is considered a strong asset.
* Proven ability to collect, clean, and analyse datasets using tools such as Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
* Familiarity with relational databases and structuring principles; knowledge of SQL or Python.
* Understanding of data visualisation principles and experience producing dashboards or analytical reports.
* Proven experience of using AI-assisted analysis tools.
* Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights and visual narratives.
* Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English


 Competencies
   

  

 Find out more about
 **EIB core competencies** 
 here
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorized disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Traineeship Recruitment team hr\_traineeship\_recruitment@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

**Your Application May Be Used For Another Campaign.**
**Please note that deadline for application is on the November 18th, 2025.**

***EIB Traineeship Programme***

***Provisions for In-service training***

title: Lead Solution Architect – Core Technology Team
description:
**Location** 
 : Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden (On-site)
   

  

**Company** 
 : Apotea AB – Sweden’s leading online pharmacy
   

  

**Team** 
 : Core Technology
   

  

**Tech Innovation at Apotea**
 Apotea is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare products accessible and efficient for everyone. We’re on a mission to build the next generation of e-commerce and logistics, from scratch, but with lots of domain expertise and genuine care for our customers (We have been selected as the best e-commerce in Sweden several years in a row — and for good reason.). Our vision in the Tech department is to redefine how AI and automation power modern businesses — not by forcing AI into traditional workflows, but by creating AI-driven and automated systems that give humans control, insight, and the ability to apply their expertise where it matters most.
   

  

 The Core Technology Team shapes the architectural foundation that supports everything we do — from e-commerce and logistics to data, AI/ML, and customer experience. We ensure that every development aligns with our long-term vision and contributes to Apotea’s growth.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Lead Solution Architect to take end-to-end ownership of Apotea’s solution architecture, ensure technical excellence, and enable our teams to deliver at scale.
   

  

**The Role**
 As Lead Solution Architect, you’ll sit at the heart of Apotea’s transformation. You will define and evolve our architecture across AWS (serverless-first) and help us realize a platform that is scalable, resilient, and ready for continuous innovation.
   

  

 This role combines strategic leadership with hands-on architectural design. At Apotea, engineers are expected to take ownership of the full software development life cycle, so your role will be both to design solutions yourself and enable other engineers to do so effectively. You will work closely with business stakeholders, engineers, and product owners to ensure every technical development is aligned with Apotea’s vision, architectural principles, and best practices.
   

  

 You will also be the first-line responsible person for all technical developments and initiatives in the Tech department, advocating a product mindset and ensuring our architecture enables both speed and sustainability. We believe in balancing fast go-to-market with long-term maintainability:
 *we like the right amount of technical debt, at the right place, and for the right purpose* 
 . Part of your role will be to define maturity plans and guide iterations as systems evolve.
   

  

 Finally, you must be able to take complex topics and clarify them, communicating solution designs and execution plans in a way that aligns the whole organization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
*Architectural Leadership:*
* Own and evolve Apotea’s target architecture with a strong focus on AWS serverless, event-driven, and data-driven systems.
* Translate business strategy into modern, sustainable technology roadmaps.
* Establish architectural guardrails and best practices for scalability, cost efficiency, and security.


**Solution Design & Innovation**
* Design end-to-end solutions for e-commerce, logistics, and AI/ML-powered workflows.
* Enable engineers to take ownership of design and execution, while sometimes leading design work yourself.
* Identify and evaluate emerging technologies that can transform customer experience and operational efficiency.
* Ensure solutions deliver on availability, observability, performance, and regulatory compliance.
* Contribute to Apotea’s architectural “toolbox” — principles, guidelines, standards, and reusable patterns.


**Collaboration & Leadership**
* Work closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment of technology and goals.
* Mentor and coach architects and engineers, fostering a design-first, product-oriented, innovation-driven culture.
* Act as a trusted advisor to leadership, balancing risks, trade-offs, and opportunities.


**Governance & Compliance**
* Embed data privacy, sovereignty, and security considerations into all architectural decisions, with close collaboration with Security Engineer.
* Ensure solutions comply with healthcare regulations and GDPR.


**We Are Looking For Someone With**
* Extensive experience in solution/software architecture, including previous experience as the main and go-to architect in an organization.
* Proven expertise in AWS with deep knowledge of serverless, distributed applications, event-driven and microservices architecture.
* Strong background in designing secure, scalable, and high-performance systems.
* Ability to balance fast iterations with technical debt management, defining maturity plans for systems.
* Familiarity with C4 model or similar for clear architectural communication.
* Experience in AI/ML platforms, data-driven architectures, or automation workflows is a plus.
* Excellent ability to collaborate across business and tech, with strong communication and leadership skills.
* Experience with programming languages such as Go, TypeScript, and .NET.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with MLOps and data lakehouse architectures.
* Knowledge of multi-tenant SaaS or distributed e-commerce and logistics platforms.
* Exposure to regulated environments such as healthcare, finance, or logistics.
* Familiarity with API/Event-first design and Test Driven Development (TDD).


**Why Join Apotea?**
* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.
* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI, ML, and automation projects that impact millions of customers.
* Opportunity to Work with modern cloud-native technologies (serverless, AI, automation, event-driven).
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* Join a culture of experimentation, collaboration, and innovation.


**About Apotea**
 Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.
   

  

 Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
* Apply
* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical Capabilities
* Interview: Culture Fit
* Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.
* Offer Presented


**Application**
 Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

***Join Us and Make a Difference -** 
**We hope you want to be a part of our team!***
*Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.
   

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!**
 Apotea är Sveriges största nätapotek med fokus på hållbarhet och snabba leveranser. Vår logistik är hjärtat i verksamheten, och vi har som mål att bli Nordens största apotek och Sveriges mest hållbara företag. Tillsammans med våra kunder har vi samlat in över 100 miljoner kronor till välgörenhet, och vi fortsätter att växa varje år – med våra medarbetare som den drivande kraften bakom framgången.

title: Senior Business Development Manager - Healthcare and Life Sciences
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Commercial discipline is responsible for driving business growth, managing partnerships, and providing industry subject matter expertise and advisory to both clients and internal teams. This strategic and consultative team creates meaningful relationships with clients through their combined knowledge of IT services and industry trends and pain points. Members include business development staff of all levels, client partners, alliances and partnerships managers, industry advisors, and operational leads.
   

  

 As a Senior Business Development Manager at Endava, you will identify new clients, and introduce them to our capabilities and IT services. You'll guide these new customers through the entire sales cycle, offering solutions that allow them to achieve business goals through enterprise transformation of their IT environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Act as a trusted advisor, selling IT Professional Services and building long-term client relationships.
* Generate and qualify leads through outreach, networking, and research to maintain a strong sales pipeline.
* Manage the full sales cycle from prospecting to closing, with a focus on strategic, high-value deals.
* Leverage deep industry knowledge to position yourself as a Subject Matter Expert and drive revenue growth.
* Engage in industry events and thought leadership opportunities, while benefiting from an aggressive commission model.


**Qualifications**
* 8-10+ years of new business development experience focused on selling IT solutions to solve customer's business challenges
* Significant experience and network within one or more of the Provider, Medical Devices, or Biotech & Pharma industries, with a strong understanding of the industry trends and challenges
* Experience leading strategic new business development initiatives to uncover opportunities with large enterprise clients.
* Sales-driven professional with hunter-centric sales experience including prospecting, cold calling, qualifying leads, conducting sales presentations, negotiating, closing contracts, and building relationships.
* Demonstrated track record of success in new business development, achieving £5M+ quota in first year and larger (£20M+) in subsequent years.


 Additional Requirements:
   

  

  

* Travel is an integral part of a this role and the individual will need to travel locally, within country, and internationally as needed to perform the role (they should have a valid passport/driving license and be prepared to travel during working hours as needed by the company).
* Work-related tradeshows or live events may require the individual to occasionally lift 25 pounds.


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: UX Desin Intern
description:
ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions is part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. Every day, we reimagine how people move through a safer, more open world with ease. If you've ever walked through an automatic door, stayed in a hotel, or gone through passport control, you've probably used one of our products or services. We have operations in over 70 countries, with over 63,000 colleagues around the world.
   

  

 Our expertise in customer journey mapping, innovation, and service design leads to the invention of new solutions that create value for our clients and exceptional experiences for their end users. And we have a fantastic opportunity available in Vingcard for a UX Design Intern.
   

  

 Part of Global Solutions, Vingcard specialises in electronic locking and access management systems for the global hospitality industry. We create seamless, secure experiences for hotels and their guests through innovative digital solutions that blend security with exceptional user experience.
   

  

 As the UX Design Intern for Vingcard, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the user experience design of access management platforms used by thousands of hotels worldwide, whilst developing professional skills in research, interaction design, and strategic thinking. The role will be based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Working closely with our Design Lead, you will support user research, create user flows and wireframes, and learn how UX decisions connect to business goals and user needs in the hospitality technology space.
   

  

**What You Will Do…**
* Create user journeys, wireframes, and interactive prototypes in Figma that solve real problems for hospitality professionals
* Conduct user research and usability testing, learning to turn insights into actionable improvements
* Design user flows and interfaces for our digital services, understanding how structure supports user goals
* Collaborate on information architecture, learning to organise content and navigation in ways that make sense to users
* Contribute to design strategy workshops and sprints, understanding how UX decisions connect to business goals
* Document design rationale, user personas, interaction patterns, and research findings to support team decision-making
* Participate in design critiques and usability testing sessions, developing your understanding of user-centred design practice


**What We Expect Of You…**
* Currently enrolled in a programme with LIA (Lärande i arbete) placement requirement
* Studying Interaction Design, UX Design, Cognitive Science, Human-Computer Interaction, or related field
* Portfolio is a must! (We understand you may not have worked on company projects yet; school assignments, personal experiments, or any work that shows your design thinking is welcome)
* Proficiency in Figma (Required)
* Basic understanding of user research methods and usability principles
* Analytical thinking and curiosity about why users behave as they do
* Ability to articulate design decisions and receive constructive feedback
* Comfortable working with ambiguity and iterating on solutions
* Strong communication skills, collaborative mindset, and eagerness to learn
* You will ideally be located in Stockholm or surrounding areas, comfortable with hybrid work (3 days/week in office)


**Plus If You Have…**
* Interest in accessibility and inclusive design practices
* Experience with user research methods or usability testing
* Experience working with Miro for collaborative workshops and ideation


**What You Can Expect From Us…**
* Mentorship & Learning: Direct guidance from our Design Lead and experienced UX professionals in a supportive team environment
* Real-World Impact: Work on products used by hotels and guests worldwide, seeing your contributions go live
* Career Development: Access to UX research resources, tools, and training to expand your skills and maximise your potential
* Collaborative Culture: Supportive and accessible leadership team with a solid values platform that underpins who we are and how we operate
* Flexible Working: Hybrid arrangement balancing office collaboration with remote flexibility


**Application**
 You can submit your application by clicking 'Apply Now'. A portfolio is mandatory for consideration (any format accepted: online, PDF, case studies, presentation, etc.). If password-protected, please provide access details.
   

  

 We will not consider applications received via email or through other channels. We will review applications continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

**About Us**
 Featuring four times in Forbes' most innovative companies worldwide, we deliver innovative, safe, and convenient security solutions that provide real added value to our customers. As a group, our goal is to help billions of people every day experience a more open world. We're proud to boast leading positions across the majority of Europe, North and South America, Asia, and Oceania, offering products and services to customers seeking solutions to their entrance and opening requirements, such as locks, doors, and entrance automation.
   

  

 We are building diverse, inclusive teams and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.
   

  

 For questions about the role or process, contact Moreno Nourizadeh, moreno.nourizadeh@assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Director of Data & AI
description:
**About Funnel**
 Funnel helps companies unlock the full potential of their marketing data. The platform empowers teams to collect, organize, and utilize their marketing data to make better decisions and fuel growth. We’re now taking a bold next step: becoming an
 **AI-first company** 
 .
   

  

 To succeed, we need a leader who is passionate about AI, deeply experienced in data, and excited to reshape how we work. This is a unique opportunity to define and drive Funnel’s AI and data strategy, with strong alignment from leadership and the board, and the chance to make a company-wide impact at speed.
   

  

**The Role**
 As our
 **Director of Data & AI** 
 , you will be the driving force behind Funnel’s AI transformation. You will own the roadmap and execution for our internal AI initiatives, ensuring our data foundation is robust and ready to power scalable, company-wide AI adoption. You will set the vision, define the strategy, and roll up your sleeves to make it happen. The latter is non-negotiable.
   

  

 You will lead our Data & AI Team — currently 5 members, growing to 7 — who design, build, and manage Funnel’s internal data stack and services. This team ensures our data is stored, modeled, and ready for use across the business, while also delivering analytics and building features that activate our data through automations and AI.
   

  

 This is not an “AI side hustle” for Funnel. It’s at the core of our company strategy. With strong support from the CEO, board, and executive team, you’ll have the mandate and resources to drive change.
   

  

 In this role, you will report directly to the COO, Nina Hammarström.
   

  

**Leadership & Personal Qualities**
 We are looking for a leader who is as comfortable shaping strategy and implementing change. Someone who can inspire, challenge, and bring people along on the journey.
   

  

* Inspiring communicator: Able to present AI initiatives to the company with clarity and energy, translating technical complexity into engaging narratives.
* Bold driver of change: Brings conviction, direction, and courage to set the agenda — and the ability to get adoption across teams.
* Collaborative partner: Comfortably work across different areas of the business, including GTM, RevOps, Product, and Engineering, to embed AI into daily workflows.
* People leader: Builds and grows high-performing teams while creating a collaborative, growth-minded culture.
* Hands-on strategist: Willing to dive into details when needed, without losing sight of the bigger picture.
* Growth mindset: Curious, open to experimentation, and passionate about continuous learning.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Technical depth: Background in engineering, computer science, data science, or analytics; fluent and comfortable in Python.
* Data expertise: Experience working with business and product data across engineering and analytics.
* AI exposure: Experience leveraging AI/ ML/ Agents to solve business problems.
* Proven leadership: Track record of leading data strategies, delivering business impact, and driving change.
* Mindset: Passion for data and AI, and a conviction that it will fundamentally reshape how businesses operate. A key part of this role is leading a data-mindset as well as AI.


**What You’ll Do**
* Define & lead strategy: Create the internal roadmap for Funnel’s AI-first transformation, from data stack to applied AI use cases.
* Drive AI adoption: Launch and scale AI initiatives across the company. Implement 2–3 tangible AI transformations that will successfully change business processes and areas with AI implementations in your first 6-9 months.
* Own the data foundation: Ensure our data stack, analytics, and engineering practices are robust, future-proof, and designed for AI. Guide the shift from our current stack into its next generation and ensure it delivers on business needs.
* Be hands-on: Roll up your sleeves to work directly with data, tools, and models — from agents to analytics pipelines — while shaping long-term strategy.
* Lead & grow the team: Manage a growing data team (5–7 people), creating a collaborative, growth-minded, and high-performing culture.
* Act as a catalyst for change: Bring bold ideas, challenge the status quo, and ensure Funnel leverages AI to fundamentally reshape how we work.


**Why Join Funnel?**
* AI-first future: A central, company-wide strategy — not a side project.
* Clear buy-in: Full support from leadership and the board.
* Resources & appetite: Budget and risk tolerance to move fast.
* High impact: Visible results in months, not years.
* Career growth: Step into a Director role with a broad scope and company-wide influence.


 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Strategic Project Manager
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Strategic Project Manager to join our Group Operations team at Instabee. In this role, you’ll take ownership of defining and implementing our Workforce Management strategy — shaping how we plan, manage, and optimize capacity across all our operations.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with senior leaders to define frameworks that balance efficiency, quality, and people. Your work will include everything from assessing our production model and introducing new ways of reporting, to identifying improvement opportunities and helping our teams across markets work smarter together.
   

  

 This is a strategic and analytical role with a strong business focus — perfect for someone who enjoys connecting dots between data, operations, and people. You’ll collaborate closely with leaders from Operations, Product Management, People and Finance to ensure our blue-collar workforce strategy supports both short- and long-term company goals.
   

  

**Some of the things you will do**
* Define and implement Instabee’s strategy and frameworks for capacity, workforce, and performance management within operations
* Partner with senior leaders across departments to align on priorities and direction
* Develop reporting and insights (such as hourly rate metrics) that guide decision-making for local managers
* Support and guide our Product Manager for Workforce Management tools in defining the right priorities and business impact
* Collaborate with Terminal, First & Middle Mile, and Last Mile teams to build scalable processes and share best practices


**Your future team**
 You’ll be part of Group Operations, a small and high-impact team responsible for enabling smart and scalable ways of working across all Instabee markets. The team works closely with local Operations teams and central functions to drive improvement and efficiency.
   

  

 You’ll report directly to the VP Operations, who will support your learning and development, and collaborate with experienced colleagues who are always up for sharing insights and helping each other grow.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 You’re a structured and strategic problem-solver who thrives on complexity. You enjoy working in cross-functional environments, influencing senior stakeholders, and turning analysis into clear recommendations and tangible results.
   

  

* 3–5 years of experience in management consulting or a similar analytical/strategic role
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset
* Excellent communication skills and ability to structure and present insights clearly
* Experience managing multiple priorities and projects independently
* A degree in math, engineering, economics, or another relevant field
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written, Swedish is a plus


**More About You**
 You’re comfortable switching between strategic thinking and operational detail, and you enjoy making complex systems understandable. You work fast, write clearly, and build trust easily with stakeholders at all levels. You’re also motivated by impact — seeing your ideas turn into frameworks and processes that actually make a difference in daily operations.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
* ⏰ Hybrid setup and flexible working hours


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Infrastrukturtekniker
description:
Vill du vara med och stärka Sveriges försvarsförmåga genom avancerad teknik och innovation? Vår kund söker nu ett helt IT-infrastrukturteam som vill vara nyckelspelare i arbetet med att utveckla och förvalta tekniska tjänster som är kritiska för företagets verksamhet. Din roll kommer att vara avgörande för att säkerställa tillgängligheten, säkerheten och stabiliteten i deras system och digitala tjänster.
 



  





 Som konsult på Eccera får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Teamet som du kommer att ingå i kommer att hantera en viktig IT-infrastrukturplattform för ett av våra kunds affärsområden, vilket är avgörande för förvaltning och utveckling av tekniska tjänster. Ett betydande fokus kommer att ligga på att säkerställa tillgängligheten till systemet, vilket kräver höga standarder för säkerhet, stabilitet och noggrannhet.
 



  





 Som person förväntas du vara organiserad och van vid att ta ansvar. Du är en person som agerar och är noggrann i dina åtaganden samt strävar efter att göra ett utmärkt arbete tillsammans med ditt team. Ditt team kommer att spela en central roll i att leverera och stödja IT-tjänsterna. Det är av yttersta vikt att genomföra och dokumentera arbetet enligt etablerade rutiner och processer.
 



  





*Just nu letar vi efter:* 



* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med minst 9 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med 4-8 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Windows med 1-3 års erfarenhet
* Infrastrukturtekniker inom Linux med 4-8 års erfarenhet



  





 Tillsammans kommer ni att ansvara för och upprätthålla en IT-infrastruktur med vanliga uppgifter. Det inkluderar att leverera klient- och serverbaserade tjänster och att vara en del av drift- och supportteamet. Ni kommer också att hantera patchning och uppgradering av klient- och servermiljön, samt utveckla skript och använda automatiseringsverktyg för att effektivisera arbetsflöden. Dessutom kommer ni att delta i utvecklingen av tjänster kopplade till infrastrukturplattformen och se till att säkerhetskraven efterlevs. Aktivt deltagande i förbättringsarbeten av tekniska lösningar kommer också att vara en del av ert arbete.
 



  





**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 




*Krav, teambaserat:* 



* Erfarenhet av att hantera Windows-servermiljöer och VDI-plattformar
* Några års erfarenhet av Linux med fokus på serverdrift
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med Redhat och CentOS
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att sätta upp nya utvecklingsmiljöer med ovanstående tekniker
* Ett genuint intresse för teknik och att hålla sig uppdaterad med de senaste utvecklingarna inom branschen



*Meriterande:* 



* Scriptningsspråk som Bash, Python eller Perl
* Kunskap inom IT- och informationssäkerhet
* Nätverksskiktet såsom TCP/IP, switching, routing och brandvägg i datacentermiljö
* Övervakningsverktyg som Nagios/op5
* Teknologier som Docker/Podman, Kubernetes, Git, Jenkins, Artifactory, PostgreSQL, Grafana, VMware
* Konfigurationshantering med verktyg som Ansible eller Puppet
* Horizon
* SCCM
* Microsofts standardprodukter såsom Active Directory, DNS, och WDS



  





 Uppdraget omfattas av försvarssekretess vilket sätter kvar på arbete på plats fem dagar i veckan. Säkerhetsprövningssamtal och bakgrundskontroll kommer att genomföras. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Eccera får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.

title: ASIC SoC Verification Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About the Opportunity:**
 Join our innovative team to apply your expertise and advance ASIC verification to the next level at Ericsson. We specialize in top-level verification of cutting-edge ASICs that power complex, high-performance systems. Integrated multi-chip modules are replacing monolithic solutions. Our designs feature hundreds of processor cores, DSPs, ARM cores, tailored hardware accelerator IPs, and numerous high-speed interfaces, including Ethernet, CPRI, and PCIe.
   

  

 As an SoC Verification Engineer, you will join a team tackling some of the industry’s most challenging verification tasks, ensuring our ASICs meet high standards for performance, functionality, and security.
   

  

 You will play a pivotal role in developing software-driven tests used in CI regressions across four platforms: SystemC/TLM simulation, RTL simulation, hardware emulation, and, ultimately, silicon.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Verify ingress and egress Ethernet traffic, involving DSPs, MCUs, switches, security, SerDes, and related components.
* Prepare and configure designs to run in hardware emulators, and maintain existing emulator platforms.
* SoC-level test development with opportunities to specialize in specific areas.
* Contribute to software-driven tests written in C.
* Debug failing test cases using the SystemC/TLM platform, RTL simulation, or hardware emulation, depending on the scenario.
* Help keep tests clean in the CI regression suite across all four platforms.
* Occasional development of sequences for UVM VIPs.
* Work with gate-level simulation (GLS), including timing simulations.


**Skills you bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a closely related field
* Proficiency in various verification methodologies such as UVM (Universal Verification Methodology), System Verilog, and VHDL
* Strong C programming skills targeted at ASICs or related embedded software
* Solid RTL debugging skills in SystemVerilog, VHDL, or comparable debugging experience
* Experience with simulation tools like VCS, Xcelium or Questa for running and debugging verification tests.
* Experience with emulation tools like Veloce, Palladium, or FPGA prototyping for faster verification and system-level testing.
* Knowledge of common Ethernet components such as MAC, MACsec, PCS, and SerDes.


**Desirable knowledge and experience:**
* UPF and low-power verification.
* GLS with timing.
* XPROP verification.


**Soft skills:**
* An open, inclusive mindset that embraces diversity in culture, nationality, and gender identity.
* A collaborative approach focused on team productivity and mutual growth.
* A strong drive for innovation with a proactive interest in refining verification methodologies.
* Clear communication skills for effective teamwork and coordination across diverse teams.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 763017

title: Data Engineer
description:
Är du en erfaren Data Engineer som vill vara med och bygga framtidens datalösningar i en organisation som satsar på digitalisering, analys och hållbarhet? Vill du arbeta hands-on med att utveckla, förbättra och driva dataplattformen som ligger till grund för Preems data- och analysarbete? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Data Engineer hos Preem arbetar du i hjärtat av vår moderna dataplattform i Azure Databricks. Du bygger och vidareutvecklar pipelines, optimerar dataflöden för kvalitet och prestanda, och skapar robusta datamodeller som stödjer både analys, rapportering och beslutsstöd.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du att ha ett nära samarbete med andra data engineers, BI-specialister, utvecklare och verksamhetsrepresentanter för att översätta affärsbehov till hållbara tekniska lösningar. Rollen är en heltidstjänst med placering på Preems huvudkontor i Stockholm. Vi tillämpar en hybrid arbetsmodell där du kan arbeta hemifrån upp till 50 % av din arbetstid. Du rapporterar till IT-chef för Digital, BI och governance.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa, bygga och vidareutveckla dataplattformen i Azure Databricks, med fokus på skalbarhet, kvalitet och prestanda.
* Optimera och underhålla data pipelines och infrastruktur.
* Utveckla arkitekturprinciper och riktlinjer i linje med Preems IT-strategi.
* Omvandla verksamhetsbehov till datadrivna lösningar med affärsnytta i fokus.
* Bana väg för användning av plattformen genom att säkerställa tillgänglighet och struktur i datamiljön.


**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Du blir en viktig del av Preem – en arbetsplats som präglas av välkomnande stämning, förtroende för medarbetarna och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Vi arbetar utifrån syftet att göra resan till en bättre framtid möjlig. Just nu genomgår vi den största omställningen i vår historia där det fossila successivt fasas ut och ersätts av förnybara alternativ. En omställning vi gör för att vi vill, kan och måste. Hos oss får du frihet under ansvar och uppmuntras att ta egna initiativ för att utveckla verksamheten framåt. För oss är det viktigt att du delar våra värderingar, Ansvarstagande, Nyskapande och Inkluderande eftersom de ligger till grund för allt vi gör.
   

  

 Hos oss får du stort utrymme för kreativitet och innovation, samt möjlighet att påverka hur vi bygger och utvecklar våra datalösningar. Du ges frihet att ta egna initiativ och bidra med idéer, samtidigt som du har stöd av ett team med balans mellan självständighet och samarbete. Du får dessutom en viktig roll i att möjliggöra datadrivet arbete i hela organisationen, genom att skapa en tydlig, tillgänglig och välstrukturerad datamiljö som andra team kan bygga vidare på.
   

  

**Har du den här bakgrunden**
 Vi söker dig som har din spets inom data engineering, med fokus på kod, struktur och tillförlitlighet. Vi jobbar med Azure Databricks som grund för vår dataanalyssatsning, och ser att du har erfarenhet av plattformen eller att du är nyfiken och snabbt lär dig nya tekniker. Kanske har du erfarenhet av andra Apache Spark-baserade plattformar. Har du dessutom ett stort intresse för Python, Machine Learning eller dataanalys, och kanske till och med kodar på fritiden för att utforska nya idéer, kommer du att trivas hos oss.
   

  

* God programmeringsvana, särskilt i Python och SQL, samt erfarenhet av relevanta bibliotek och ramverk.
* Djupgående kunskap om data lakes, data warehouses och verktyg för att effektivt orkestrera och hantera dataflöden.
* Erfarenhet av att skapa, optimera och underhålla data pipelines för effektiv och skalbar datahantering.
* Vana att arbeta nära både tekniska team och affärsenheter för att förstå och möta databehov.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och att arbeta enligt DevOps-processer.
* Relevant akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik eller liknande område, alternativt motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.


**Är det här du**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är en person som både är analytisk och kreativ. Du gillar att samarbeta men är också självgående och tar egna initiativ. Du har ett flexibelt förhållningssätt till teknik och problemlösning och du drivs av nyfikenhet och viljan att förstå på djupet. Vi lägger stor vikt vid din passion för området, din förmåga att tänka strategiskt och din vilja att utvecklas både tillsammans med teamet och på egen hand.
   

  

**Nästa steg**
 Vi ser fram emot att ta emot din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men allra senast 28 november 2025. Du ansöker genom att bifoga CV samt besvara urvalsfrågor. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Då vi tillämpar löpande urval så kan rollen komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Om du har frågor om rollen eller rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Camilla Waernelius, Recruiting Partner, camilla.waernelius@preem.se
   

  

 Då Preem bedriver samhällsviktig verksamhet genomförs alltid bakgrundskontroll samt alkohol-& drogtest inför ett anställningserbjudande. Vid intervju ska godkänd ID-handling i form av ett pass eller nationellt ID-kort, alternativt folkbokföringsbevis tillsammans med giltigt körkort kunna uppvisas. Preem bedriver till del säkerhetskänslig verksamhet varför säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras om befattningen så kräver. Säkerhetsprövningen genomförs i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Facklig kontaktperson finns
 **här.**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Preem är Sveriges största drivmedelsbolag. Vår vision är att leda omvandlingen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Senast 2035 har Preem som mål att producera cirka 5 miljoner kubikmeter förnybara drivmedel och vara klimatneutrala i hela värdekedjan.*
*Preems raffinaderier räknas till de mest moderna och miljöanpassade i Europa med en raffineringskapacitet på över 18 miljoner kubikmeter per år. Vi förädlar och säljer drivmedel, eldnings- och smörjolja samt andra produkter till företag och privatpersoner.*
**Vi har ett rikstäckande servicenät med ca 500 stationer för privat- och yrkestrafik. Preem AB har cirka 1 600 anställda varav 1 100 arbetar vid raffinaderierna. För helåret 2023 var Preems omsättning 138 miljarder SEK.**

title: Software Engineer - Master Thesis
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 We are DICE, the award-winning studio with locations in Stockholm and Gothenburg, Sweden, best known for creating the phenomenally successful Battlefield franchise. We are now part of a set of global studios building a connected Battlefield universe, focused on Battlefield’s one-of-a-kind multiplayer suite, with teams also part of the development of a single-player narrative campaign.
   

  

 We strongly believe our people are the backbone and driving force to our creative products, and are always looking for diverse game creators to join us in Stockholm, Gothenburg or working remotely, to help us build the best Battlefield experiences and make our studio the best in the industry.
   

  

**Master Thesis - Open Application**
 We are looking for Master Thesis students to work on our team and go deep in any of a wide range of problem spaces. While we welcome a variety of research approaches, we are especially interested in projects that incorporate Generative AI or Machine Learning technologies. If you’re excited about leveraging these transformative techniques to tackle challenges in game development, we would love to hear your ideas!
   

  

 For this current hiring cycle, we are looking for you who is interested in exploring any of the following subjects:
   

  

* Core Systems / Optimizations - Enhance engine efficiency: Focus on optimizing core systems like multithreading and hardware utilization to improve game performance across diverse platforms.
* Productivity Tools - Streamline development processes: Investigate how Frostbite’s suite of tools can be refined or expanded to boost development efficiency and creativity in game production.
* Rendering - Push graphical boundaries: Utilize Frostbite’s high-fidelity rendering capabilities to innovate in real-time graphics, exploring areas like ray tracing and complex lighting models.


 An open application means that you can provide ideas for what you want to work on, but we can also explore this together, based on your experiences and interests.
   

  

 What We Offer We offer a stimulating environment mixing research and game creation, we encourage creative, innovative and novel thinking.Here you get to work close with researchers and deliver to game studios that ship games to an audience in the order of millions.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 We are looking for students with a background in computer science or similar - maybe you major in something else, but you are probably still interested in the programming side of things and you have an interest in working in games. Experience in Unity, Unreal, Maya, or Houdini will also improve your merits as well as fluency in C++ or C# depending on topic.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Please apply online with a CV and cover letter. Also, state what project you would like to work on and explain your pick based on your interests and skills.
   

  

 This internship is unpaid and temporary employment. It needs to be associated with a university education or any other type of education that has an internship period planned into the education plan, for example, LiA. We are not able to provide relocation services for this role, so we will only consider candidates already residing in Sweden.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: EIB Trainee - Portfolio Management & Monitoring Directorate - Intermediated Lending Division - based in Luxembourg
description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and require regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment.
   

  

 The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its
 **Portfolio Management & Monitoring Directorate (PMM) - Joint Middle Office Department (JMO) - Intermediated Lending Division (IL) - Implementation, Delinked RS and Central Allocation Unit (IDCA)** 
 , at its headquarters in Luxembourg:
 **TRAINEE**
***Duration: 5 months (fixed start date: 1st***
***March/April***
***2026)***
***(With possible extension up to 6 months if required by University)***
***Please note that, as marked on our Webpage, only applications from nationals of the Member States of the European Union, as well as citizens from countries that have been officially granted candidate status to join the EU, can be considered (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Georgia, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Serbia, Turkey and Ukraine).***
***Candidates whose Erasmus+ programme overlaps with the duration of the traineeship will not be considered.***
***Please note that you are requested to limit your applications to a maximum of three traineeship publications. We will only consider and retain the first three applications submitted.***
 Objective of the traineeship
   

  

 The function relates to supporting the strategic projects ongoing in EIB's Middle Office Division in charge of monitoring EIB operations intermediated by Financial Intermediaries.
   

  

 The intermediate lending Middle Office monitors the transactions with Financial Intermediaries:
   

  

* Benefiting from EIB funding to be on-lent to eligible beneficiaries for eligible projects, or
* Benefiting from a guarantee from the EIB, where risk is shared with financial intermediaries on a portfolio of eligible loans.


 The objective is to realise operational efficiency gains by supporting the implementation of IT developments and digitalisation initiatives relevant for monitoring of intermediated operations in the Joint Middle Office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 You will support senior colleagues in charge of business analysis, project management and strategic planning tasks of the Intermediated Lending monitoring division to enable the implementation of the ongoing initiatives.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Supporting the technical developments in the different IT applications used by the Joint Middle Office Department Intermediated Lending Division (JMO/IL) by contributing to the implementation of new system updates. This involves participating in the parametrisation, testing and migration to the new systems.
* Support the design and documentation of information and learning material relevant to the monitoring activity of EIB intermediated loans and guarantees,
* As required, you will support the division with the usual monitoring activities.


 You might also assist the JMO/IL division in other projects that might arise.
   

  

**Academic Qualifications And Professional Skills**
* Final year of studies or University degree preferably in Business Administration, Economics, Information Technology, Engineering or equivalent.
* Good understanding of the EIB's mission and activities as well as of the EIB financial products.
* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office applications incl. MS365, Copilot, Outlook & Word, excellent knowledge of Excel.
* Analytical skills and data management abilities.
* Experience with software development, programming or use of visual platforms would be an advantage.
* Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English. Knowledge of other EU language would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

 Find out more about
 **EIB core competencies** 
 here
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorized disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Traineeship Recruitment team hr\_traineeship\_recruitment@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

**Your Application May Be Used For Another Campaign.**
**Please note that deadline for application is on the November 18th, 2025.**
***More information on our***
***EIB Traineeship Programme***
***and***
***Provisions for In-service training***
